description:
Adaptive Construction Solutions, Inc. (ACS) is a workforce development organization focused on transforming lives through meaningful employment. The Data Analyst is responsible for inputting, aggregating, analyzing, and communicating the conclusions from program data for executives.

Responsibilities


Research, identify, and capture usable data for analytical purposes
Perform and validate quality assurance of data
Analyze, model, and interpret program data to support objectives and identify trends
Prepare custom and recurring data reports for executives that are readable and goal-driven
Execute strategic data analysis and reporting initiatives
Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems and inaccuracies developing protocols for processing and cleaning data
Document and update policies, procedures, and best practices
Produce analysis products related to workforce and economic development
Convert data into diagrams, charts and infographics
Present data and analysis to customers and stakeholders
Work directly with management team to gather requirements, provide status updates and build relationships
Learn operational processes and provide recommendations for improvements
Other duties as required

Candidate Requirements


Bachelors Degree in computer science, mathematics, business, or similar field
A minimum of two years experience in data analysis
Advanced knowledge of Excel
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with executives
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to pass a background check
Able to work in and promote a drug free environment
Preference for veteran applicants

Compensation: Starting at $60,000

Location: Houston, TX

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

Exempt, full-time position which may require additional hours and weekend work.

ACS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Business/Operational Analyst
Department: Finance
Company: Dimension Development
Reports To: Assistant CFO
Supervises: N/A

Job Purpose: Thoroughly analyzes financial and operational key performance metrics and clearly communicates findings to stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Use proprietary software (Dimension Development Hotel Accounting Program) as well as external sources to identify, generate, gather, verify, review, research, analyze, comprehend, interpret, and report on key performance indicators and financial information.
2. Analyze variances and data trends and prepare reports, charts and other outputs as required. To convert information into insightful findings and actionable recommendations to optimize existing and future operations across the company.
3. Provide high-quality recurring and ad-hoc performance reports to assist senior management with operational decisions, as required.
4. Assist the Assistant CFO with the development and maintenance of various analytical models.
5. Prepare a monthly reporting package that includes financial, operational, competitive, and customer satisfaction metrics. To analyze key business trends.
6. Work closely with all regional and property leaders to identify areas of improvement. To support and contribute expertise to projects relating to the achievement of property financial, guest service, and operational goals.
7. Assist hotel leadership with the actual implementation of new processes.
8. Assist with the preparation of annual budgets. To consolidate budget data from business unit leaders, evaluate data received and follow up directly with budget holders as appropriate. Ensure that all budgets are accurate, comprehensive and completed on time.
9. Serve as a super user of business intelligence tools (such as Broadvine and MicroStrategy) in the creation of dashboards and reports.
10. Research and evaluate different analysis tools, business intelligence tools, and modeling techniques to identify possible opportunities for process improvement.
11. Other duties as assigned.

Job Skills:
1. Track record of problem solving complex issues and continuous process improvement skills.
2. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required, and will be tested, including pivot tables and advanced formulas. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office.
3. To maintain a thorough understanding of financial and operational metrics across the industry.
4. Ability to work proactively, independently and as a strategic partner in a cross-functional team environment. To establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with fellow team members, management, external contacts, guests, and the public. Demonstrated ability to manage conflict/resolution.
5. Demonstrated strong analytical skills. To define and analyze problems and identify root causes. To set challenging and productive goals; prioritizing tasks, accepting responsibility, and overcoming obstacles.
6. To work successfully in a dynamic, fast-paced setting, and effectively manage multiple priorities within a broad team of cross-regional and cross-functional members. To perform a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another of a different nature, with frequent interruptions and distractions. To adapt to frequent changes in the workload and be able to adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate while completing tasks within established timeframes.
7. To thrive in an environment that is both strategic and creative, and which requires rapid learning, multitasking and prioritizing under tight deadlines
8. To remain highly-driven and self-motivated. To remain positive, productive, and professional in high stress situations.
9. To maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail at all times. To be well-organized and detail-oriented in order to manage multiple tasks, deadlines, and expectations simultaneously.
10. To sustain a high level of confidentiality.
11. To demonstrate partnering, influencing, and communication skills at all levels of the organization.
12. To maintain excellent written and verbal communication and comprehension skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex analytical topics to a wide audience who may or may not be familiar with analytics or the subject matter.
13. Other duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications: Describe the minimum qualifications needed to complete the job responsibilities.

Education: Bachelor's Degree in a business or hospitality field, or equivalent work experience. Advanced degrees or certifications are preferred.

Experience: One year experience in the job offered or two year’s experience in a business intelligence or similar analytical capacity or related role. Hospitality/Entertainment Industry experience is preferred.

Work Location: Remote or home based

positionName: Audit Data Analyst – Information Systems Audit
description:
Information Systems Audit is part of the Harris County Auditor’s Office Audit Division. The department consists of a data analytics team and an information services audit team. The data analytics team supports all the Audit Division teams and the County Auditor in successfully employing the use of advanced data analytics.

The Information Systems Audit – Data Analytics team is looking for a dedicated team player who shares their passion for data and process improvement to provide analytics support to the Harris County organization.

Audit Analysts are expected to assist in the performance of Continuous Auditing activities. This involves the use of data analysis tools such as IDEA/ACL, Python, PowerBI, Tableau, etc. The Audit Analyst assists in the development and enhancement of the overall Continuous Auditing activities. The position also assists with the running and review of scheduled audit analytics, resolving issues, and reporting results to management as necessary. The position also assists in developing periodic audit engagements designed to identify Continuous Audit opportunities and assist in developing analytic engagements. Ability to communicate with audit and client management.

The Audit Data Analyst will:
Contribute to the development, execution, monitoring, evaluation and delivery of data models, data prep routines, analytics, and other initiatives of our audit analytics strategy across the Harris County departments.
Actively drive the integration of data analytics and associated data visualizations into internal audit projects to deliver innovative, insightful, and actionable analyses.
Bring their innovation, sound professional judgement, critical thinking, follow-through, initiative, attention to detail, and industry and functional expertise while leveraging advanced analytics to drive successful audits.
Perform business validation and quality assurance testing of audit analytics platform content.
Ensure the work performed is in accordance with quality standards of the organization; and
Present technical solutions to team members and leadership.
KEY JOB FUNCTIONS:

Identifies relevant and applicable datasets required to obtain desired results.
Takes the data and use the appropriate tools to validate accuracy/completeness, and identifies anomalies, trends, inconsistencies, or potential risks.
Presents those findings (using visualizations where appropriate).
Assists with the development of continuous auditing programs to identify exceptions on a regular/routine basis.
Assists with the identification of the organization’s risks.
Assists with data analytics for various projects performed throughout the year, including requirements brainstorming, data acquisition, data management, iterative analysis design and analytics, and data visualization (where appropriate) for various engagements.
Assists with the development of dashboards and related reports for key stakeholders.
Identifies, understands, and acquires large underlying information/data to meet objectives.
Assists with large-scale data mining and data science projects as well as ad hoc statistical and data mining analyses.
Summarize results to present anomalies, error rates, and dollar impact from anomalies / exceptions.
Presents results of analyses to business auditor teams, explain technical and statistical concepts to non-technical/non-statistical associates and vice-versa.
Assists in supporting internal audit’s quality control and improvement program to ensure compliance with Institute of Internal Auditors (IIA) standards by supporting KPI / KRI dashboard development, trending, and reporting.
Assists with the alignment and standardization of data analytics and audit procedures.
Supports completion of quality assessments.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Harris County is an Equal Opportunity Employer
https://hrrm.harriscountytx.gov/Pages/EqualEmploymentOpportunityPlan.aspx
If you need special services or accommodations, please call (713) 274-5445 or email.
ADACoordinator@bmd.hctx.net
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in accounting, computer science, auditing, business, or related subject from an accredited college or university.
Experience performing data analysis and using data analytics tools (e.g. IDEA, ACL, Excel, Access, Python, Tableau, etc.).
Basic knowledge of security and application controls, IT best practices and exposure to an IT related field of study.
Willingness to achieve a relevant certification (e.g. CISA, CIA, Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate).
 Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Good command of the English language in oral and written communication skills.
Knowledge of data analysis tools such as IDEA/ACL, Python, PowerBI, Tableau, etc. Hands-on experience preferred.
Proficiency in the use of MS Excel, MS Word, MS Access, and MS Outlook.
Familiarity with PeopleSoft data a plus.
Must be able to analyze complex information and identify anomalies and trends.
Ability to deal with people effectively and proficiently.
Ability to maintain a high degree of judgment, discretion, and confidentiality of sensitive information
Ability to travel throughout Harris County as needed, with minimal overnight and out-of-County travel.
Physical Requirements:
Ability to sit for extended periods of time, push/pull up to 50 lbs., and lift and carry up to 20 lbs.
General Information
WHAT WE OFFER:
Competitive salary up to $61,000/year. Salary commensurate with experience.
Hybrid schedule with remote work
Excellent benefits and wellness programs
Zero-premium medical plan for employees
Outstanding retirement program
Continuing professional education and professional organization memberships
Collaborative work environment
Subsidized transit/commute

Houston, TX

At Houston Methodist, the Data Analyst position is responsible for the provision of analytical support of data generated by the department. This position will assist in creating, designing and implementing processes to ensure accurate data collection and input. The Data Analyst position will assist with maintenance of department database and on-going training of end users. This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing and reporting statistical information and patient outcomes to both external and internal customers which may include statistical power and sample size determination, inferential hypothesis testing, algorithm development and numerical methods, data mining and knowledge discovery in databases. Reporting duties for the Data Analyst position will involve the provision of monthly departmental reports and ensuring timely regulatory reporting completion. Additional responsibilities for this position include making recommendations for the implementation of technology and processes required to support the goals of the department with emphasis on regulatory compliance. The Data Analyst position will complete or assign other data requests.

Requirements:
PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Job responsibilities labeled EF capture those duties that are essential functions of the job.

PEOPLE - 20%
Communicates results of queries in database systems and upgrades regarding electronic protocol management system to coworkers, staff and management. (EF)
Completes and works directly with physicians, clinical staff and management on customized data queries and other requests for operational and research needs. (EF)
Fosters teamwork approach in all interactions with peers and team members. Anticipates needs of other team members; proactively offering assistance. Provides contributions towards improvement of department scores for turnover/retention/employee engagement. (EF)
SERVICE - 30%

Provides troubleshooting logic in relation to technical support. (EF)
Provides and/or supervises gathering, entering and auditing of data in database. (EF)
Assists with design and implementation of processes to ensure accurate data collection and input. (EF)
Performs statistical analysis interpretation by preparing reports (monthly, quarterly and/or as needed) on productivity, quality activities, trends and other clinical or business metrics relevant to the department. (EF)
QUALITY/SAFETY - 15%

Conducts routine data processing and implementation of quality control methods. (EF)
Develops standard operating procedures. Ensures compliance with all HIPAA/confidentiality regulations. (EF)
In conjunction with management, participates in performance improvement program for department. (EF)
FINANCE - 20%

Conducts, as appropriate, statistical power and sample size determination, inferential hypothesis testing, data mining and knowledge discovery in databases. (EF)
Responsible for all aspects of clinical data analyses for multiple studies. (EF)
Programs and develops algorithms for numerical methods and develops workflow and data pipelines as needed for project(s). (EF)
GROWTH/INNOVATION - 15%

Collaborates with Technology regarding software system proposals, purchases, installations, upgrades, enhancements and modifications. (EF)
Identifies and assumes responsibility of own learning needs, consults with team experts and seeks continuing education opportunities to meet those needs. Completes and updates the individual development plan (IDP) on an on-going basis. Ensures own career discussions occur with appropriate management. (EF)
This job description is not intended to be all inclusive; the employee will also perform other reasonably related business/job duties as assigned. Houston Methodist reserves the right to revise job duties and responsibilities as the need arises.

Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte's Information Technology Services (ITS). We are curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation.

Work you'll do


US Cyber Data Protection team is responsible for securing and protecting confidential data of Deloitte US Member Firm, our Clients and our Employees. Team's core mission is to implement consistent security controls to protect Firm's data and data entrusted to us by our Clients to build their trust and protect our brand. We are seeking an experienced and energetic US Cybersecurity Data Protection Analyst with outstanding communication, analytical and cyber security technical skills to join our Cyber Data Protection team within Information Technology Services (ITS) Organization.

If you're an experienced, hands-on IT professional with strong systems administration, engineering and cyber security technical skills who's interested in growing in the cybersecurity field, this may be the job for you. As part of our Cyber Data Protection team, you will be assisting in designing, deploying and managing technology and process solutions to reduce the potential of data compromise. You will be assisting with testing of data protection and data security solutions. You will work to enhance and mature cyber security data protection capabilities for Deloitte US Member Firm. You will require an understanding of the entire ecosystem of data protection including well-rounded understanding of the information security domains and their inter-relations across that ecosystem. You will be responsible for providing technical product and troubleshooting assistance to Deloitte Employees. You will work closely with management, leads, peers, development teams, business analysts, and end users to ensure data protection for systems are used by all areas the organization.

Responsibilities:

As part of the US Cyber Data Protection team, you will have the following core responsibilities:
Assist with the development, deployment and support of data protection solutions
Assist with the implementation of data security controls and design principles
Provide Tier 2 support to end users for cyber data protection services including, but not limited to web security, cloud access security broker, date encryption, key and certificate management, advanced threat protection, digital code signing, endpoint detection and remediation, data loss prevention, data classification and rights management, data retention and destruction, data access governance, data discovery etc.
Assist in maturing data protection solutions protecting against data exfiltration
Assist in rolling out new data protection services to employees, getting them adopted and providing on-going support for those services
Assist with technology and software reviews based on data protection and endpoint risks
Provide technical engineering and troubleshooting support to employees for data protection services

The team


Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.

The ~3,000 professionals in ITS deliver services including:
Cyber Security
Technology Support
Technology & Infrastructure
Applications
Relationship Management
Strategy & Communications
Project Management
Financials

Cyber Security


Cyber Security vigilantly protects Deloitte and client data. The team leads a strategic cyber risk program that adapts to a rapidly changing threat landscape, changes in business strategies, risks, and vulnerabilities. Using situational awareness, threat intelligence, and building a security culture across the organization, the team helps to protect the Deloitte brand.

Areas of focus include:
Risk & Compliance
Identity & Access Management
Data Protection
Cyber Design
Incident Response
Security Architecture
Business Partnership

Manage requests from internal client groups regarding Master Data requests, all requests must be completed in a timely manner.

Partner with peers to provide solutions, guidance to resolve business related problems.

1+ years of SAP experience is preferred; experience working specifically in SAP SD Module is preferred.

Your Future Team
We all want a future that’s worth looking forward to. Helping people achieve their goals is what VALIC is all about. We call it being FutureFIT. FutureFIT is all about our customers owning their future — living tomorrow the way they choose — and enjoying life the way they want. We’ve helped millions of individuals plan for, save for and realize the financial goals they’ve set. With the combined strength and diverse products of AIG member companies and VALIC powering your efforts, you can provide a uniquely high level of personalized retirement and financial planning— and make a real difference in the lives of those who deserve your help.
Your Contribution to the Company
As an influencer at AIG, people come to you as a “go-to” source for help and support because of your deep knowledge and expertise. As a more experienced team member, you are capable of driving continual improvement and impacting the way that things get done. Because of your influence, whether direct or indirect, we are able to deliver powerful outcomes for our clients.
Position Description
In general the VFA Business Analyst helps with functions such as system administration, access provisioning, technology support, management reporting, internal audit requests, management of client and advisor data updates, keeping procedures current, organizing and managing electronic records, ensuring departmental compliance with system access provisioning, troubleshooting system issues, and regular system maintenance of the Winops system. They will become familiar with the vendors contacts for the Wealthscape, Envestnet, and DST Vision Professional systems as well as the users that have access to those systems.
This Business Analyst position will be responsible for the following:
Creating VFA Audits/Reports
Ordering Computers and Equipment for New Employees
Daily, Weekly, and Monthly Maintenance of VFA System WinOps
Creating report for Vendors and Internal processes
New Rep Setups in all VFA System
VFA Website Updates
VFA System PW resets
Internal audit items
Monthly Microsoft Patch Verification
Problem solving as issues arise throughout VFA
Special Projects and Tasks as requested
What we are looking for:
Bachelor’s degree with 3 years of broker dealer back-office OR at least 6 years of broker dealer back-off experience preferred.
FINRA 7 license is a plus but not a requirement.
Exceptional communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills with the ability to interface effectively within and across departments.
 Exceptional presentation and business writing skills.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Ability to prioritize competing tasks to meet business needs.
Organized, with the ability to complete multiple tasks under various deadlines with minimal supervision.
Strong analytic skills; ability to analyze large volumes of data while recognizing inconsistencies and/or erroneous information or trends.
Must have advanced Microsoft Office skills
Microsoft ACCESS skills - ability to develop databases is a plus.
Hands on self-starter, with track record of learning new, complex topics
Demonstrated flexibility and adaptability
Acts with sense of urgency when needed
Results focused
Detail oriented

Summary
The Data Analytics Associate will provide data management and statistical support for research and operational projects within the Epidemiology Program of the Cancer Center. The successful candidate will work closely with Program Directors and Faculty on a wide range of projects to meet the goals of the Program. This position will also collaborate with other Faculty and Staff across the Department and College, as well as with collaborators outside of the institution.
The Center for Epidemiology and Population Health and the Epidemiology Program in the Cancer Center are vibrant research divisions within the Department of Pediatrics. They are expanding to meet the growing research needs at Baylor College of Medicine and Texas Children's Hospital.
Job Duties
Assists Faculty with defining project plans, milestones and timelines.
Interprets data and analyzes results using statistical techniques and provides ongoing reports.
Develops and implements databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquires data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filters and "cleans" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and project indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Works with Faculty to prioritize projects and information needs.
Attends project meetings and capture decisions, issues, and action items.
Assists with writing documentation for reports, manuscripts, and grant applications.
Works with Data Managers and Research Coordinators to identify and correct data errors.
Works with Faculty and Data Managers to develop and implement data quality control/assurance procedures.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree.
Two years of relevant experience.

Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree in a related field with no experience may also be considered.

The candidate thrives on collaborating with data warehousing and business intelligence professionals and with university administrators to achieve a seamless delivery of analytical information that is aligned with the university’s data strategy. The candidate proactively seeks out emerging issues relevant to Rice’s data needs and proposes questions and possible solutions.

$71,300 - $84,000 depending on experience and qualifications.

Proven quantitative and qualitative research skills

Demonstrated ability to take initiative and independently plan, organize, coordinate and perform work in various situations where numerous and diverse demands are involved

HP’s Sustainable Impact Mission
HP is committed to becoming the world’s most sustainable and just technology company by 2030 by focusing on our Planet, People, and Community. Position Overview
As HP positions ourselves as a “sustainable and just” technology company, there is continual work needed and growth required to back up this brand positioning. As the Sustainable Impact E2E Data Analyst the focus is on enabling the Sustainable Impact PMO to thrive. This role will be responsible for data strategy and governance, reporting and analytics, and automation. The person in this role will work closely with Enterprise Architect Team, Transformation Organization including Information Technology, Sustainable Impact Team and Sustainable Impact PMO to ensure E2E management of SI 2030 metrics, goals, and key performance indicators (KPIs).
What you would be doing:
Innovation and best practices
Lead the data architecture design and data quality standards

Streamline ESG tool usage and operational processes, including self-service reporting capabilities, automated dashboards, and reliable data flows
Manage interfaces with HP IT and enterprise architecture team, communicating needs, targeted outcomes, and estimating resourcing
Support adoption of Agile ways of working across Sustainable Impact team and collaborating functions
Manage program performance by analyzing operational data, deriving insights, and implementing automated solutions to drive operational process improvements
Tracking, Reporting, and Change Control
Drive process to collect, maintain and publish quarterly metrics for the corporate Sustainable Impact dashboard including climate action, human rights and digital equity goals with data owners from across organization.
Measure and communicate key trends of business KPIs through data analysis working across organizational boundaries to ensure timely and effective management of the SI data to support the SI 2030 goals
Risk and Issue Management
Proactively identify data and reporting risks and work with respective stakeholders to put mitigation plans in place
Executive Reviews/Communications
Communicate technical concepts to non-technical colleagues
Design operational strategies to scale delivery key executive updates
Liaise with peers in Corporate Affairs and the Sustainable Impact Team to execute on the program initiatives supporting the Sustainable Impact PMO
What you will bring:
Bachelors or master’s degree or equivalent
8+ years of work experience, in leading or working in a global environment responsible for E2E data management
Experience in partnering with Enterprise Architecture, IT and other key business stakeholders
Ability to effectively engage and work with a global team
Experience in proactive risk assessment and agile project delivery
Should have knowledge of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG)
Should have excellent communication skills in both written & verbal English (and have worked in global/multicultural environment)
Experience with data and reporting, analytics & data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, R, QlikView, etc.
Understanding of the SAP reporting environment and modules at user level
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, Power BI, SharePoint, and virtual collaboration tools

Summary

The primary purpose of the Data Analyst position is to apply technical expertise to collect and analyse clinical data , to coordinate and carry out translational Upper GI research projects.

Key Functions

Plans, organizes, and assists Principal Investigator to direct complex research projects involving detection and elimination of gastro-esophageal cancers.


Maintains an accurate database for each specific project. Monitors and transfers patient information from the medical records into the electronic database and files. Assists with clinical data analysis for translational research projects. Reports results of the analyses including original data, with conclusions.


Utilizes in depth medical knowledge of GI cancer biology, human immunology, molecular biology and bioinformatics for diverse translational projects.


Demonstrates excellent writing skills and prepares drafts of manuscripts , protocols, SOPs for research projects, and grant reports.


Assists in screening and enrolling patients to research protocols, including taking informed consent in accordance with federal regulations.


Categorizes the slides and blocks and enter the availability of specimens in the database. Order requests for re-cuts, frozen sections, sequencing tasks with the central lab facilities ,as per the goals of the project.


Communicates and collaborates with staff, faculty and investigators on research projects inside and outside of MDACC. Discusses the research findings and participates in the presentation of research results via verbal presentations, abstracts, publications, and posters.


Marginal or Periodic Functions:

Other duties as assigned or required.

Bachelor's degree in Biology, Nursing or related field. Three years of related experience. Additional years of education may be substituted for experience on a one to one basis. Job Description:
The successful candidate will be responsible for forensic examinations of computer and cell phone evidence and/or forensic examination of audio and video evidence. The basic responsibilities of the analyst include but are not limited to:
Preserve and analyze data from electronic data sources, including computers, servers, and mobile devices, ensuring that the evidential integrity of the data is not compromised.
Specialized technical work in the clarification/enhancement, conversion, repair, and reconstruction of audio and video evidence.
Retrieval of evidence from analog and digital CCTV systems, both in lab and at off-site locations.
Report detailed findings in preparation for review by investigators, prosecutors, or legal counsel, explaining complex technical concepts to nontechnical people.
Conduct validation testing and performance verifications of various hardware/software tools.
Assess and troubleshoot a variety of technical issues.
Form and articulate expert opinions based on analysis and report findings.
Provide expert testimony in depositions, trials, and other proceedings.
Must be willing to be on-call to respond to calls after hours/weekends/holidays.

Required Experience:
A minimum of two years’ experience working with analysis of digital and/or analog evidence is required. Demonstrated expertise with clarification tools is also required. Demonstrated proficiency in the examination and enhancement of digital evidence. An advanced degree may be considered as meeting partial experience requirements. CCO/CCPA (Cellebrite), CFVT/CFVA (LEVA) and/or CFVE (IAI) certification is required. CFCE, CCME, or GFCE certification is strongly preferred. Bachelor’s degree in Digital Media Forensics, Computer Science, Forensic Science, or closely related field is required. A graduate degree is strongly preferred. Equivalent experience as a multimedia or digital forensic analyst may be considered in lieu of a degree.
Knowledge of ISO/IEC 17025 accreditation standards.
Demonstrated skill in oral and written communication.
Demonstrated skills in handling multiple tasks and prioritizing work assignments.
Demonstrated ability to effectively handle conflict and uncertain situations.
Demonstrated ability to work with frequent interruptions and changing priorities.
Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain effective communications and working relationships with fellow employees, internal customers, and external customers.
Ability to lift computers that can weigh up to 50 lbs.

CORE ANALYST I
SUMMARY
Qualified applicants must perform laboratory testing with emphasis on Petrophysical Work, Rock Mechanics and/or Flow Studies. Must be familiar with and able to utilize Laboratory Instruments effectively. Qualified applicants must be able to interpret scientific data, perform mathematical and scientific computations, maintain laboratory notebooks, be comfortable in a laboratory environment, and check for accuracy. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and basic computer skills are required.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Recording operating data from laboratory equipment including flow pumps, pressure transducers and gauges, scales and balances, resistivity monitors, and basic laboratory glassware.
Working independently on projects while maintaining a team atmosphere with other technicians.
Communicating data and results with supervisors and clients in a clear manner.
Researches the formation, dissolution, and content of rock layers.
Other Responsibilities:
Applicants may be required to perform administrative duties related to project management include software management, sample management and technical report writing. Field work is required to obtain material for testing. Overtime work and various shifts may be required in order to meet the needs of the business and of our customers.
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
A bachelor’s degree in Geology or related science is preferred. Should have knowledge of materials, methods, and the appropriate tools to develop laboratory testing systems designed for simulating reservoir behaviors. Preferred a strong emphasis on logical and mechanical reasoning in a laboratory environment. Must be computer literate with working knowledge of MS Office.
LANGUAGE SKILLS
Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, management and other employees of the organization. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to read, analyze and interpret technical and scientific journals, technical procedures, or government regulations. Ability to respond to inquiries or complaints from clients.
MATHEMATICAL SKILLS
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals, and calculate area, circumference and volume. Ability to compute rate, ration and percent and interpret various graphs used to analyze data. Ability to apply mathematical operations to such tasks as determination of test reliability and validity, analysis of variance, correlation techniques, and sampling theory.
REASONING ABILITY
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of geological data problems. Ability to deal with formulas, scientific equations, and graphs.
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
Valid driver’s license and a good driving record.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, reach with hands and arms, and taste or smell.
The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to fumes, or airborne particles. The employee is frequently exposed to toxic or caustic chemicals. The employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and is occasionally exposed to risk of radiation.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Other roles involved could include producing and managing the delivery of activity and value analytics to external stakeholders and clients. Positions in this function will leverage subject matter expert views in the design of their analytics and algorithms

The Engineering Department of Harris County Precinct 2 is seeking a GIS & Data Analyst to develop, implement and manage GIS data and organizational structure/database environment. The selected individual will be responsible to create maps and exhibits related to a diverse precinct project portfolio that includes roadways, bridges, traffic signals, drainage improvements, parks, and facilities. He/she will be responsible to implement and maintain GIS-based web applications and maps to support multiple departments.

The GIS & Data Analyst will coordinate with various Harris County departments, various Precinct 2 departments, engineering and planning consultants, local community leaders, and stakeholders.

Develops, implements, and manages GIS data and organizational structure/database environment.

Researches, evaluates, implements, and maintains hardware and software changes and upgrades.
Meets with and/or makes presentations to stakeholder groups and the general public to convey goals and objectives, technical direction, and general status of projects.
Communicates effectively with constituents, other county agencies, utility providers, senior management, elected officials, their staff, and other public agencies, as the precinct’s representative
Prepares project status and performance reports.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Job Profile Summary
The head of Data Analytics sub-discipline is the most senior individual contributor in the Data Analytics sub-discipline at bp. The head of data analytics sub-discipline drives deep strategic thinking by combining their technical expertise with strong business acumen and data domain knowledge. The individual continues to be hands-on, for example carrying out analysis, reviewing code and providing actionable, pragmatic insights in technical design reviews.
Job Advert
The head of Data Analytics sub-discipline is the most senior individual contributor in the Data Analytics sub-discipline at bp. Driving deep critical thinking by combining technical expertise with strong eye for business and data domain knowledge. The opportunity to be hands-on, for example carrying out analysis, reviewing code and providing actionable, pragmatic insights in technical design reviews.
About the role
Define, set and propagate strategy for bp in collaboration with the VP, Data & Analytics.
Identify, lead, and build overarching group-level Data Analytics programs.
Establish, own and shares standards and best practices for Data Analytics across bp.
Instil a culture of actionable data-driven decision making.
Elevate bp’s external profile in Data Analytics, a real role model.
Develop an identity and community within the Data Analytics team.
Pioneer new use cases in the Data Analytics space and carry out key data analyses using statistical methodologies themselves.
Recommends the canonical set of Data Analytics tools across the organization.
Works in collaboratively with development teams to provide technical guidance on Data Analytics
Provide insights, stays at the leading edge of emergent trends and technologies and advises the executive team and senior business leaders on the introduction of new Data technologies.
Mentors others and in conjunction with People and Culture builds data analytics learning paths to upskill and reskill bp talent.
About you:
Technically deep and hands-on individual
Strong communication and partnership skills
Razor sharp execution skills and ruthless prioritization capabilities
Deep experience in product experimentation and statistical analysis e.g. A/B testing, multi-armed bandits, causal inference from observational data.
Advanced SQL and ETL skills
Masters or PhD in Statistics
5+ years of applied experience, preferably in B2C tech companies
Leadership experience a plus
No machine learning / deep learning skills required
No prior experience in the energy industry required

Overview
CommonSpirit Health was formed by the alignment of Catholic Health Initiatives (CHI) and Dignity Health. With more than 700 care sites across the U.S. & from clinics and hospitals to home-based care and virtual care services CommonSpirit is accessible to nearly one out of every four U.S. residents. With our combined resources CommonSpirit is committed to building healthy communities advocating for those who are poor and vulnerable and innovating how and where healing can happen both inside our hospitals and out in the community.
Responsibilities
The responsibility of the position is the planning, designing and delivery of reliable and efficient standard integrated analytics that support The Texas Division and facilities’ strategic priorities of quality initiatives.
Utilizing quality data from the sources of truth identified/defined by the enterprise. Sources may include publicly reported databases, quality benchmark platforms, the enterprise national data warehouse and other selected clinical or regulatory data reporting tools (including the facilities’ Electronic Health Record) to perform valuable clinical/quality analysis.
Under the guidance and direction of the clinical analytics leadership, they will work closely with division and hospitals’ quality teams to provide analytic support. The projects for this role will include, but are not limited to: enterprise quality dashboards, predictive analytics, advanced analytics, data visualization, outcomes measures, quality improvement, statistical and advanced modeling techniques using different types of health data, and coordinate with quality and clinical teams to develop data based recommendations and presentations to support stakeholders’ planning and decision making.
Align with the national analytic strategy to be a resource in support of the Texas Division clinical analytics needs.
Work with the Texas Division Clinical Analytics Team members to help develop and support analytic project plans with tactics, key deliverables, and timelines to support the Division’s quality, regulatory or benchmarking reporting needs.
Work with customers, such as quality and clinical teams, to define the analytic needs and to provide analytic support for division/hospital quality improvement initiatives.
Collaborate with quality, division analytic leaders, service lines, clinical informatics, finance and others in a complex organizational matrix to achieve transformation using analytics.
Facilitate the development and maintenance of standard definitions for clinical analytics.
Responsible for proactively identifying opportunities to improve customer focus, system thinking and quality (data and functionality). Can readily identify efficient and effective options for new solutions.
Uses standard statistical and analytic approaches (Hypothesis Testing, Correlational Analyses, Predictive Modeling, Data Visualization, etc.); defining the appropriate methodologies through the identification of strengths and limitations of alternatives.
Identifies opportunities for organizational process re-engineering and performance improvement to deliver and optimize standard division analytics with the greatest possible reliability and efficiency.
Guide and mentor other analysts in the department during initiatives and projects as needed.
Other duties as assigned by management.

Qualifications
Education and Licensure
Required:
Bachelor’s Degree in related discipline
Minimum Experience
Required:
5 years of relevant experience
Minimum Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
5+ years’ experience defining requirements and developing health care specific analytics required.
A foundation typically in analytics, statistics, and data modeling in healthcare settings.
Knowledge of analytic best practices within healthcare and across analytically driven organizations.
Ability to analyze raw data and disseminate results, with ability to think logically and process sequentially with a high level of detailed accuracy.
Demonstrated ability to manage and measure/monitor daily/weekly/monthly operational processes to achieve implementation of a long-range enterprise analytics strategy.
Organizational skills to facilitate a productive & healthy working environment.
Innovation, design, planning, implementation, project management skills.
Ability to transform ambiguous conceptual models into operational practice.
Ability to analyze data, synthesize information, transfer knowledge.
Ability to develop, sustain & optimize diverse professional relationships.
Ability to motivate, influence, mentor, coach and build high performing teams.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize projects to meet scheduled deadlines.

GENERAL SUMMARY

The Policy and Data Analyst plays a critical role in the efficient administration of assisted- housing and client service programs for low-income households served by the Houston Housing Authority. The Policy and Data Analyst leverages policy expertise, technology, and creativity to collect, analyze, format, and present information to residents, voucher holders, Houston Housing Authority leadership, community stakeholders, and policymakers. The Policy and Data Analyst's work improve daily business functions and inform the Houston Housing Authority's short and long-term decision-making, work plans, and business system evaluations. Reports to the Interim President & CEO or other department heads as duties require.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for collecting, analyzing, and presenting data and information from all Houston Housing Authority program areas for use in various plans, reports, and informational collateral, including but not limited to multiple internal and external communication products.
Create and maintain Monthly Reports for the Houston Housing Authority's Board of Commissioners.
Create and maintain monthly Dashboard Reports for President/CEO.
Contribute towards the production of Annual Reports.
Create/contribute towards the production of regular and special projects, publications, and reports.
Develop and execute regular needs assessments of data collection and aggregation to maximize data analysis's impact on the Houston Housing Authority's strategies, policies, and procedures.
Work with IT staff to develop and maintain valuable data inquiries and practical reports.
Perform impact analyses of the proposed policy and/or program reforms.
Perform other duties as assigned and/or required.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Skilled and experienced at visually presenting quantitative and qualitative data required.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Word, and PowerPoint are required.
Experience with statistical packages (STATA, SPSS, etc.) and SQL preferred.Uses multiple resources, quantitative and qualitative research methodologies to capture, interpret and communicate information.
Experience with Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, and Photoshop, one or more required.
Experience with Geographic Information Systems preferred.Produce Annual and Five-Year Plans, including but not limited to creating timelines, drafting, proofing, managing the public process, and submitting to HUD.
Takes a creative approach to translating complex information into "easy-to-understand" visual and narrative representations.
Coordinate communications, meetings, and projects vertically and horizontally throughout an organization.
Ability to work simultaneously on several projects.
Ability to prioritize workflows to meet deadlines.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to create and maintain strong working relationships.Approach work conscientiously and methodically and sees tasks through to completion.
Knowledge of federal affordable housing programs, focusing on the Housing Choice Voucher and public housing programs preferred.


COMPLEXITY / SCOPE OF WORK

The Policy and Data Analyst performs a wide variety of tasks.
The supervisor determines the course of action, but the employee has the discretion to coordinate, integrate and/or prioritize their tasks as necessary to produce a high-quality product promptly.

SUPERVISORY CONTROLS

The Policy and Data Analyst receives instructions from the President & CEO and periodically from other senior leaders.
The supervisor established procedure, or the employee, depending on the assignment, may determine the course of action, deadlines, and priorities.
The employee initiates routine activities without supervisory direction.
The employee is required to make independent decisions based on Agency goals, strategies, and regulatory requirements.
Problems or situations not covered by instructions are generally referred to the supervisor for resolution.
The employee's work is reviewed for accuracy, completion, and compliance with policies and procedures.


PERSONAL CONTACTS

Personal contacts are with other Houston Housing Authority employees, outside agencies, public housing residents, Housing Choice Voucher holders, applicants, and government officials.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORK ENVIRONMENT

Work involves the normal risks or discomforts associated with an office environment but is usually in an area that is adequately cooled, heated, lighted, and ventilated.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Public Administration, Public Policy, Urban Planning, Economics, Graphic Design, or related field required.
Three (3) years of policy analysis experience, or a combination of education and experience.
A Master's degree in Public Administration, Public Policy, Economics, Graphic Design, or Urban Planning is strongly preferred.
Bondable.
Valid Texas driver's license or obtain such within the first thirty (30) days of employment.
Eligibility for coverage under Houston Housing Authority fleet auto insurance.

Aon is looking for a New Business Analyst
As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions supporting Commercial Risk & Health, in Houston, TX.
Your impact as a New Business Analyst
The U.S. Commercial Risk and Health New Business Analyst (“NBA”) will work with U.S. Commercial Risk and Health Sales and Marketing to operationalize a growth strategy and measure new business activities in U.S. Commercial Risk and Health office(s). The NBA will report the North America Sales Operations and Effectiveness Leader with a secondary reporting line to the Resident Sales Director (RSD). The NBA will work closely with the RSD to operationalized local growth strategies with support from the North America Sales Operations leader and team.
Job Responsibilities:
1a. New Business Implementation & Support
Work with the RSD to identify the appropriate new business initiatives to activate in the local office, primarily with the Producers and Account Executives (Sales Team)
Participate in meetings with the Sales Team to develop prospect identification and client penetration strategies
Develop and distribute revenue, client acquisition activity, and benchmark reports (e.g., Local Market Analytics, Heat Map) that provide regional and local leadership with the supportive analytics need to implement strategic goals
Provide strategic guidance and operational support to local leadership in the adoption and implementation of U.S. Commercial Risk and Health Sales strategy; to include (not limited to) strategic valuation, collateral and implementation timeline
Provide strategic guidance and operational support to U.S. Retail Marketing and U.S. Sales Effectiveness to ensure all leads are assigned. Follow up on assigned leads to determine opportunity status
At the direction of the Sales Team, research prospects and clients, using analyst reports, SEC reports, Yahoo! Finance, and related sources of information, to identify prospect- and client-specific risk profile information
Identify with the Sales Team ideal prospects and clients for marketing campaigns; working cooperatively with Marketing assets to populate Aon Connect (“AC”)
Execute national sales initiatives at the local level; including, industry, product, cross-sell and named account strategies as directed by U.S. Commercial Risk and Health Sales
Coordinate annual business planning and goal allocation process with local office leadership and National Sales Effectiveness team
1b. New Business Revenue Tracking & Measuring
Prepare revenue and pipeline composition analytics for office sales meeting and monthly forecast calls
Develop and maintain pipeline composition reporting functionalities that reflect forecasted and ultimately recognized sales revenue, working closely with U.S. Finance to maintain accurate revenue pipelines to reconcile opportunity valuation
Collaborate with sales and marketing colleagues to review marketing campaign effectiveness reports and recommend actions locally that will improve effectiveness
Collaborate with local marketers to ensure delivery of local events
Ensure the Office and Individual Sales Plan, including Quarterly Producer Assessment reporting is completed on time and accurate
Provide operational assistance and strategic analysis to Sales Team and Pursuit and Creative Team (PaC) for prospect and client presentations
Provide operational support to the RSD and RMD by providing revenue analyses to include valuation of individual and office performance to goal, office sales and marketing statistics (e.g., Client Promise results, prospecting Activity, wins and losses, deal size, and sales cycle in general and by product and industry, using AC, the Sales Effectiveness Report), resource identification, and follow-up communication, including any resource documents.
You Bring Knowledge and Expertise
Experience
Passionate self-starter who can juggle multiple projects, follow-up and exhibit creative problem solving – ultimately delivering projects and assignments on target and on time within a fast-paced environment
Strong ability to work closely with various cross functional groups, specifically with the Director of Marketing, Regional/Resident Sales Director, RMD, Producers and AEs in the office, as well as with Industry/Practice Leaders and National Sales Effectiveness Team
A creative thinker who brings innovative ideas, new perspectives and a wealth of enthusiasm
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, organizational skills and relationship skills
Process-oriented person who can provide a clear, complete analysis that support sales efforts, resulting in revenue win for the company
Education:
Qualifications include bachelor’s degree in Business or related major, excellent Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PPT, Word, etc.). Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management Systems (CRM) and marketing automation systems (i.e. Eloqua)
A minimum of 2+ years of research experience or related formal training.
We offer you
A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

positionName: Data Analyst II - Defense & Veterans Center for Integrative Pain Management
description: Join the HJF Team! HJF is seeking a Data Analyst II to support the Defense & Veterans Center for Integrative Pain Management (DVCIPM) located at Brook Army Medical Center in Fort Sam Houston, TX. HJF provides scientific, technical, and programmatic support services to DVCIPM.The incumbent will provide analytic support to epidemiologists, biostatisticians and scientists. Ensures data quality and data integrity. Conducts statistical analyses.Responsibilities: Imports, cleans, transforms, validates and/or model data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision making and public health purposes. (30%)Assists in making data accessible to epidemiologists, scientists, physicians, programmers and other end users. (10%)Tests data to identify data integrity issues, making recommendations and coordinating with the data manager to plan solutions. (10%)Troubleshoots problems concerning database records and communicate with co-workers and end users of the system. Makes recommendations and coordinates with the data manager to plan solutions. (10%)Recommends operating methods to improve processing, distribution, data flow, collection and database editing procedures. (10%)Participates in data-related projects, including but not limited to data normalization, data maintenance, data research, data standardization, data product development, data quality assurance, and dissemination of findings. This may include attendance of and participation in required training for role.Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  Knowledge and application of data cleaning, migration, organization, and analytic approaches. Demonstrated analytical skills and passion for analyzing data. Experience with data modelling and common analytic software programs. SQL and R skills strongly preferred. The position may require an ability to learn new programming languages or software systems on-the-job. Openness to learning and applying knowledge regarding health equity and disparities. Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous development, modeling inclusive behaviors, and proactively managing bias. Company Overview: LiquidPower Specialty Products Inc. (LSPI) is the global leader in the science of drag reduction. In 2014 LSPI was acquired by Berkshire Hathaway, having previously been a wholly owned subsidiary of Phillips 66. LSPI provides flow improver solutions, delivering strategic value to its customers by maximizing the flow potential of pipelines while increasing their operational flexibility, capacity and economic performance. LSPI works with companies in more than 35 countries to solve pipeline flow needs, treating more than 12 million barrels of hydrocarbon liquids a day and providing customers with a total package solution that includes flow improver products and the right injection equipment. Job summary

At Amazon, we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven leaders. If you would like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

He/she will experience a wide range of problem solving situations, strategic to real-time, requiring extensive use of data collection and analysis. Amazon’s Workforce Staffing (WFS) team is looking for a Labor Analyst to join the WFS Management team. As a Labor Analyst in WFS Management team, you should be an expert in the architecture of Data Warehouse solutions for the Enterprise using multiple platforms. You should excel in the design, creation, management, and business use of large and complex datasets. You should have excellent business and communication skills to be able to work with business analysts and engineers to determine how best to design the data warehouse for reporting and analytics. In this multi-purpose leadership role; you will assist in the planning, directing and leading all phases of vendor relationship/partnership; providing consultative approach to recruiting; ensuring strategies are executed; and deploy and manage WFS processes to our external staffing partner. Successful candidates will be a strategic and analytical thinker who can see around corners and demonstrate a passion for process improvement, candidate experience and onboarding process improvement. Our WFS and Staffing Partners work flexible schedules, shifts, and areas to include evenings and weekends. We roll up our sleeves, work hard, have fun and make history!

Innovative and creative in finding solutions/ designing improved methods, systems and processes.
Attention to detail and high capability for data mining and analytical work.
Manages the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of Workforce Staffing performance via Key Performance Indicators
Evolves and implements labor acquisition strategies inclusive of employee class recommendations, labor pool utilization, talent pool conversion and other channel resources across different Amazon businesses
Partners with local Site Leadership teams to include but not limited to Operations, Finance, Human Resources, and associated workflow teams to optimize labor requirements

Evolves and implements strategies based off consistently changing needs of the business by tracking hiring event schedules and forecasted attendance rates

High level of computer literacy with advanced Excel skills.
Excellent analytical, investigative and problem solving skills.
Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with a range of people at all levels in the organization, often in virtual teams spread across multiple time zones.
Excellent planning, organizational and time management skills with the ability to deal with multiple demands on time.
Designing, implementing and supporting a platform that can provide ad-hoc access to large data-sets
Modeling data and metadata to support ad-hoc and pre-built reporting
Experience managing and prioritizing business types and locations, projects and relationships
Local travel up 50% of the time

3+ years of relevant experience in a labor analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis role
3+ years of professional experience working with large data sets and writing complex SQL queries to pull data
3+ years’ Experience with Excel spreadsheets and data analysis

company: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth)
description:
Position Summary:
We are looking for a Data Management Analyst to work with our Development team. This role functions as an overseer of the donor database. You will be responsible for data accuracy, integrity, and security of all constituent records, and for maintaining and enhancing the highly confidential data of the Office of Development’s database system (Raiser’s Edge). You will be responsible for ensuring the overall effectiveness of the database, data input and output, reporting, technology management, and end-user training and support. You will need to be able to design and run reports on a routine and ad hoc basis. Knowledge of SQL, Crystal Reports as well as Tableau is preferred. Candidates will need to have an extreme attention to detail, and knowledge of fundraising strongly preferred.
This is a full time role that is classified as exempt. It will be located in the heart of the Texas Medical Center at our University Center Tower. This employee is eligible for all UTHealth benefits including comprehensive healthcare coverage and participation in the State of Texas retirement plan.

Position Key Accountabilities:
Produces routine and ad hoc reports by using standard Raiser’s Edge reports and designing Crystal reports as needed. Includes working with development staff and external department staff to design and produce mailing lists, financial and operations reports, and data analyses for use by senior university and department management, development officers, prospect researchers, other development staff, and external departments.
Analyzes the effectiveness of the database in meeting the needs of the Office of Development, particularly in the areas of tracking fundraising goals, prospect moves management, and response rates to various fundraising efforts.
Designs and implements methods and policies for using the database effectively, and documents such practices and policies. Develops and applies policies and procedures to safeguard data security, maintains the confidentiality of all data, and ensures the integrity of the data.
Processes new data or changes to existing data, researching and verifying such information as needed. Includes items such as address changes, other demographic information, portfolio assignments, fund/account information, event attendance, alumni information, etc.
Coordinates with the university’s Information Technology department on software upgrades and patches, as well as other technical issues.
Provides basic end-user Raiser’s Edge training for Office of Development and other university staff, as well as troubleshooting assistance for minor technical difficulties relating to access to and use of the database, passwords, etc.
Keeps abreast of trends in the field of data management, emerging technologies, and available data management tools.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Certification/Skills:
Excellent analytical, organizational and communication skills.
Exceptional attention to detail. Knowledge of the fundraising process.
Proficiency in MS Excel, Access, Word, and Outlook.
Proficiency with relational databases (Raiser’s Edge experience preferred), particularly data imports and exports and developing reports.
Working knowledge of Crystal reports and Tableau.
Intermediate knowledge of SQL.
Experience running and reading quantitative reports and the ability to understand their meaning enough to judge accuracy.
Training certification from Blackbaud, Inc. preferred.

Minimum Education:
At least a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a related field.
Minimum Experience:
Three (3) years of experience managing relational databases, preferably Raiser’s Edge or a similar donor/alumni database system. At least one year of professional experience in a fundraising/development office.

Physical Requirements:
Exerts up to 50 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to 20 pounds frequently and/or up to 10 pounds constantly to move objects.
Security Sensitive:
This job class may contain positions that are security sensitive and thereby subject to the provisions of Texas Education Code § 51.215

Demonstrates working knowledge of common database and statistical software packages. Statistical packages such as R, SPSS, SAS

and Statistica are used to merge various databases originating from REDCap, EPIC, Excel or Access. Builds REDCap projects. Data is


cleaned, labeled and documented according to standard analysis criteria for the department.


Data Analysis:

Analyzes data according to approved protocols and research plans and summarizes findings for principal investigators. Assists in the


organization of study folders that detail the purpose of the study, sample forms, data dictionaries, preliminary analyses and database


structure.


Data Mining:

Establishes databases and manually enters or download data to populate. Quality control procedures are utilized to verify data

is accurate. Keeps a log of data entry and coding difficulties and consults with assigned research nurses. Requires absolute attention to

detail.

Manuscript Development:

Writes up analysis results and collaborates on abstracts, posters, grants and manuscripts with faculty and research staff. May include

writing drafts, generating tables and figures and searching for references. Perform literature searches through Medline/Ovid and

Pubmed.

Technical Support:

Perform data backups on departmental server drives on a routine basis and on demand. Document scanning, PDF conversion, Optical

Character Recognition (OCR) transforming PDF documents in editable documents. Other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION:
Required: Bachelor's degree in Biology, Nursing or related field.


EXPERIENCE:
Required: Three years of related experience. Additional years of education may be substituted for experience on a one to one basis.

Preferred: Advanced knowledge of statistical procedures in R, SPSS, SAS or other statistical software. Advanced knowledge of REDCap and other database software. Statistical programming, advanced knowledge of MS Office/Access and familiarity with other work productivity software.

Who are we?
Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment and eCommerce company, comprised of four market leaders: Ticketmaster.com, Live Nation Concerts, Front Line Management Group and Live Nation Network. Ticketmaster.com is the global event ticketing leader and one of the world’s top five eCommerce sites, with over 26 million monthly unique visitors. These businesses power Live Nation Network, the leading provider of entertainment marketing solutions, enabling over 800 advertisers to tap into the 200 million consumers Live Nation delivers annually through its live event and digital platforms. Who are you?
Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on!
The Role:
The Regulatory & Legal Compliance Data Analyst will work closely with the Regulatory & Legal Compliance Director to support oversight and statistics across the workstreams of the Regulatory & Legal Compliance Program. This position will work closely with key stakeholders across multiple functional and business groups to facilitate Regulatory & Legal Compliance across the Live Nation Entertainment portfolio.
WHAT THIS ROLE WILL DO
Work closely with the Regulatory & Legal Compliance Director by supporting statistics and providing data analysis for the Regulatory & Legal Compliance Program including required Policy & Procedures, Corporate Training & Education, and Technical support where applicable
Process information from a database of appropriate Compliance and Industry appropriate laws & regulations, conduct gap assessments against current LNE practices, and provide data to support operational processes
Apply your experience in data modeling, quantitative analysis, data mining, and data presentation to identify, analyze and provide insights into large data sets
Contribute data analysis for positioning, messaging, and storytelling across multiple releases and solutions, this may include working with the Corporate Training team to develop training for compliance programs as well as monitor compliance of those trainings
Analyze and assess content within a knowledgebase of best practices and key learnings
Work on multiple projects or programs of high complexity and/or high visibility
Build and nurture relationships and partnerships with internal and external team members to achieve desired results
Develop metrics, dashboards, and reports for Regulatory & Legal Compliance related program activities
WHAT THIS PERSON WILL BRING

Advanced MS Excel skills
Experience using BI tools
Business Objects or Tableau Experience a plus
Excellent computer skills including experience with word processing, spreadsheets, and databases
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills required
Ability to work with cross functional stakeholders in order to meet organizational goals within deadline
Ability to work in large global environments spanning multiple time-zones a plus
Ability to maintain discretion with sensitive and confidential information
Passionate and willing to learn

Company Description
Wood Mackenzie is the global leader in data, analysis and consulting across the energy, chemicals, metals, mining, power and renewables sectors.
Founded in 1973, our success has always been underpinned by the simple principle of providing trusted research and advice that makes a difference to our customers. Today we have over 2,000 customers ranging from the largest global energy companies and financial institutions to governments as well as smaller market specialists.
Our teams are located around the world. This enables us to stay closely connected with customers and the markets and sectors we cover. Collectively this allows us to offer a compelling combination of global commodity analysis with detailed local market knowledge.
We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging. We are committed to creating a workplace that works for you and encourage everyone to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join.
Hear what our team has to say about working with us:
https://www.woodmac.com/careers/our-people/
We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!
At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.
Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.
But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.
It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.
At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.
At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.
