Position Purpose:
In this role, you are a Business Leader: you should be an effective communicator, aspiring, and able to drive insights into actions that improve Sysco’s business results. You’ll need to mine multiple sources of data, including syndicated data (NPD, Technomic’s, etc.), derive actionable insights, and translate complex results into simple conclusions that will empower business leaders to take action to win with our customers.
You will present insights that will educate and influence Business and Executive leadership to drive profitable growth. With a combination of analytical expertise, data and system knowledge and business acumen, you’ll answer and anticipate critical business questions and opportunities and deliver critical insights to the business in ways that make significant impacts. You will drive analytics on key growth initiatives and mentor other associates within the organization.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Define strategic analytical approach to synthesize data and identify trends, patterns, and insights to drive critical projects, lead advanced analytics, and present key findings to business leaders
Drive continuous improvement projects to deliver meaningful insights based on strategic KPIs, hypotheses, and metrics
Collaborate with cross functional team of business leaders to define and influence category strategies through data-driven insights and advanced analytics
Work with leadership throughout Sysco to frame business opportunities and develop appropriate analytic strategies
Lead problem solving sessions to develop analytical solutions that contribute to the overall profitability of Sysco
Develop in-depth business, analytical and systems knowledge to improve or build analytical solutions, approaches, and business recommendations
Design & develop appropriate mechanisms for tracking & performance management (e.g., Tableau dashboards, reports)
Lead in the development of team culture, mentoring other associates, and development of skills and processes
QUALIFIATIONS:
Bachelor's Degree required (Business, Computer Science, Mathematics or Analytics degree preferred), Master’s degree a plus
4 years of relevant professional experience required
SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Understanding of business value drivers and corresponding business impact
Strategic thinking skills (making complex decisions, innovation, dealing with ambiguity, etc.) as well as excellent analytic, and quantitative skills
Problem-solving skills with proven ability to influence others across the organization
Ability to synthesize, visualize, and effectively communicate complex data into effective storytelling to provide business recommendations
Self-motivated individual who is comfortable working with diverse business scenarios, handling multiple priorities and have a business & consultancy mind-set, while technically (data) savvy
Passion about discovering new things and ability to learn quickly
Good communication skills, self-motivated, dynamic, reciprocal, and "can-do" attitude
Data management and visualization skills / tools (SQL, Tableau, PowerBI or similar)
Collaborative team player who can effectively work in a matrix/cross-functional organization
Advanced Microsoft Office skills
Experience analyzing, synthesizing, and communicating syndicated data analytics (NPD, Technomic’s, Nielsen IRI, etc.)
Project management capabilities preferred
Experience working in distribution, retail, or wholesale industry preferred

Sysco is the global leader in foodservice distribution. With over 57,000 associates and a fleet of over 13,000 vehicles, Sysco operates approximately 326 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 625,000 customer locations.
We offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations. We’re looking for talented, hard-working individuals to join our team. Come grow with us and let us show you why Sysco is at the heart of food and service.

JOB DESCRIPTION: Your roles as a Business Intelligence developer is to help design, build, and deploy data visualization solutions to support our analytics needs throughout the organization. The Regular Price Optimization (RPO) Analyst plays a key role in the day to day function of the Pricing Department, and is responsible for executing and managing the pricing strategies aligned to by the Sr. Director of Pricing, Sr. Manager of RPO Pricing, Buyer and Planner. This position is responsible for overall price optimization based on approved strategies across multiple lines of business. The position is accountable for pricing integrity (price accuracy) for regular pricing and assisting the Buyer/Planner meet margin expectations as budgeted. The RPO Analyst is responsible to assure accurate, timely execution of all regular price changes, and helps investigate all store price issues
Job Description:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of related work experience required
Courses in management, marketing, finance or economics preferred
Work Experiences:
Experience in a retail, marketing or finance environment preferred
Skills:
Proven problem solving, analytical and decision-making skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Self-starter able to initiate and drive projects to completion
High attention to detail with the capacity to meet tight deadlines and stay organized
Intermediate MS Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint & Word)
Comfortable learning new skills including software applications
The ability to work within a team environment
Price optimization, Oracle RMS, Structured Query Language/SQL or MS Access are a plus
Positive demeanor with a can-do attitude and strong work ethic
Communication – effective listening, speaking, reading and writing
Acceptable level of hearing and vision to perform job duties
Responsibilities:
Drives all changes for regular retail pricing using Revionics and Oracle Retail Price Management (RPM) software.
Act as subject matter expert in Revionics and RPM and works with others in the Pricing and Merchant teams to maintain and drive value from these applications.
Owns and delivers the price optimization exercises as scheduled and prepares every day forecast reports.
Manages relationship with merchant partners to capture approval required to execute regular price changes during pre-season planning.
Audits price changes for accuracy
Analyzes current and future prices along with promotional / advertising flyers to ensure price accuracy and customer satisfaction.
Coordinates price change efforts with merchant and store teams to ensure communication and execution needs are met.
Acts as the first level of contact for pricing inquiries coming from the stores, analyzes the situation and decides on corrective actions.
Determines pricing best practices related to RPM and other price execution processes.
Monitors price change submissions and checks for proper format and timeline compliance.
Runs reports / analyzes data necessary to perform the job.
Leads or participates in ad hoc projects as required.
Required to learn company policies, procedures and safety rules
Physical Requirements & Attendance
Acceptable level of hearing and vision to perform job duties
Adhere to company work hours, policies, procedures and rules governing professional staff behavior
Regular attendance required
Full time

At CEVA, we believe that logistics is a people business, that’s why we create an environment of trust and team spirit - we encourage initiative and we empower our talent to grow in their careers. We are supply chain experts and live and breathe it every day. We offer a broad range of services in Contract Logistics, Air, Ocean and Ground management thanks to our 78,000 employees, operating in more than 160 countries. At CEVA, we are passionate about our work and the value we deliver to our customers and as a company, we are growing at a fast pace - do you Dare to Grow with us?

YOUR ROLE
We are hiring a Business Analyst to join our Global Digital Transformation team.
You will work as a Business Analyst on various digital products and report directly to the Global Digital Lead. Your main tasks will include performing detailed requirements gathering and analysis, documenting processes, and performing user acceptance testing. Additionally, you will work with the Digital and the local product teams to work on our Innovation proof of concepts and pilots.
To succeed in this role, you should have an analytical mindset and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users and your management.
WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO?
Lead the process design in new projects defined in the Digital roadmap.
Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats
Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications, user stories, job stories, acceptance criteria etc.
Improve systems by studying current practices, designing modifications
Recommend controls by identifying problems, writing improved procedures
Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and roadmap elements
Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
Contribute to team effort by accomplishing identified tasks as needed
Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analysis and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making
Conduct regular workshops and interviews with end users to collect feedback and communicate it to product management.
Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes
Train and guide other business collaborators on the final product’s process flow and all systems and tools involved
Create informative, actionable, and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analysis to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Education
Bachelor or master’s degree in engineering or equivalent
Fluent English
Spanish/French is a plus
Tertiary qualifications in Freight Forwarding, Customs, Supply Chain, or other similar industry.
Experience as a Business Analyst
Experience in testing applications and leading UAT campaigns
Experience working with APIs and databases.
Experience delivering digital products in an Agile environment.
International and/or remote job experience
Technical Skills
Ability to work from home
Ability to work remotely with a team spread over various distances and time zones
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Strong analytical and synthesis skills, including ability to absorb and process large amounts of data into actionable information
Good understanding of technical constraints in designing software.
Ability to explain and expose complex problematics
Autonomous in designing test scenarios and running test campaigns.
Software design & documentation
Easy communication skills, ability to lead and animate discussions.
Detailed reporting and good presentation skills
Previous experience in a digital project is a plus
Soft skills
Analysis
Teamwork
Process Improvement
Big Picture Thinking
Deadline commitment
Communication
Problem Solving
Critical Thinking
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
Relationship Building
WHAT DO WE HAVE TO OFFER?
With a genuine culture of recognition, we want our employees to grow, develop and be part of our journey. We offer a benefits package with a focus on your wellbeing. This includes competitive Paid Time Off, 401(k), health insurance and an employee benefits platform that offers discounts on gym memberships and a diverse range of retail, travel, car and hospitality brands, including important offerings like pet insurance.
We are a team in every sense, and we support each other and work collaboratively to achieve our goals together.
It is our goal that you will be compensated for your hard work and commitment, so if you’d like to work for one of the top Logistics providers in the world then let’s work together to help you find your new role.
ABOUT TOMORROW
We value your professional and personal growth. That’s why we share plenty of career opportunities for you to thrive within CEVA. This role can be the first step on your career path with us. You can stay in the same job family, find a new family to grow in (an almost limitless number of options) or find your own path. Join CEVA for a challenging and rewarding career.
CEVA operates in a multicultural, global environment and is a richly diverse organization operating seamlessly as one company. We aim to attract, motivate and retain the best people in our industry, whatever their background. We share the same passion to deliver world-class solutions to our customers. We have the best supply chain professionals in the industry and develop this talent in an inspiring work environment.
CEVA Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunity work place and an affirmative action employer. Position Title: Business Analyst (4E)
Position Summary
 The Business Analyst works as part of a cross-functional team to identify business needs and define potential solutions. These solutions may consist of business process improvements as well as information systems components. The successful candidate will work closely with various members of Real Estate Acquisitions (REA) to streamline processes and enhance technical systems. They will gather requirements from the business to translate and interface on with the technical development organization.
Essential Job Functions
Complete process reviews, model business process, and develop process maps.
Work with representatives from the various lines of business to identify process improvement opportunities and to assist in developing potential solutions.
Decompose business and user requirements into requirements specifications to a level of detail suitable for use by those that must base their work on the requirements.
Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely.
Participate in peer reviews of work products and documents.
Manage assigned projects to completion, ensuring that all activities are coordinated and completed on time and within budget. Track and report project progress, using standard methods and procedures to monitor critical project issues.
Facilitate internal meetings with managers and other team members.
Ensure proper and effective communication regarding process changes. Assist with the development of training as necessary.
Act as a liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
Education/Certifications
High school diploma or equivalent
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Analytics, Finance, Tech, MIS or related field preferred
Experience/Minimum Requirements
Minimum of two (2) + years of experience in the analysis and development of business processes and in the writing of functional requirements supporting systems development
Possess an understanding of established process development and improvement and agile systems development methodologies
Foundational understanding of the Crown business model and the telecommunications industry
Other Skills/Abilities
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Understanding of metrics and their use to drive behavior and process change
Knowledge of the Information Systems development process (e.g. Requirements Definition, User Testing, etc…)
Ability to build and maintain relationships across cross-functional teams and to work effectively in a matrix organization
Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
Experience working in PowerBI and Oracle preferred
Organizational Relationship
Reports to: Business Process Manager
Title(s) of direct reports (if applicable): N/A
Working Conditions: Works in a normal office setting with no exposure to adverse environmental conditions. We offer a hybrid working model with 3 days in local office and up to 2 days working remotely each week.
Additional Information: N/A

Two Sigma is a financial sciences company, combining data analysis, invention, and rigorous inquiry to help solve the toughest challenges in investment management, insurance technology, securities, private equity, and venture capital.

Our team of scientists, technologists, and academics looks beyond the traditional to develop creative solutions to some of the world’s most complex economic problems.

We are seeking a talented data specialist to join our highly motivated and innovative Data Engineering team. You'll be part of a close knit, dynamic team of passionate individuals critical to the success of Two Sigma's business.

You will take on the following responsibilities:
Analyze and curate massive amounts of data for thousands of different tradable instruments, including stocks, bonds, futures, contracts, commodities, and more;
Create systematic, automated processes and tools that allow the team to scale and rapidly onboard new datasets;
Collaborate with business partners, software engineers, and other data analysts to understand business needs and then design and develop reliable data pipelines that produce high quality datasets;
Support the day to day operations of Two Sigma by applying problem solving, pattern detection, and root cause analysis to a wide range of data issues in a fast paced environment;
Help drive continuous improvements to the team’s data quality procedures and a consistent approach to how data quality is measured, monitored and reported;

You should possess the following qualifications:

3+ years professional experience in an environment that prioritizes data quality
A bachelor’s degree with a strong academic record, which includes university coursework in programming and computing systems
Exposure to hands-on Python and SQL coding in the context of data pipelining in a professional environment. Prior experience with Jira, Bash, GIT desired.
While financial industry experience is a plus, we are open-minded in our search for critical thinkers who are passionate about technology and data.

You will enjoy the following benefits:

Core Benefits: Fully paid medical and dental insurance premiums for employees and dependents, competitive 401k match, employer-paid life & disability insurance
Perks: Onsite gyms with laundry service, wellness activities, casual dress, snacks, game rooms
Learning: Tuition reimbursement, conference and training sponsorship
Time Off: Generous vacation and unlimited sick days, competitive paid caregiver leaves

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Patterson-UTI Drilling
The New Standard for Drilling Performance

Drill safer, smarter and faster with Patterson-UTI Drilling’s comprehensive fleet of pad-capable rigs featuring advanced walking systems to enhance your operations so you can reach your apex.
The Lead Data Analyst will be responsible for supervising Data Analysts and managing data analytics projects of varying complexity, working closely with the developers, engineers, operations, sales/marketing teams and customers. Utilizing data and tools from the PTEN+ Drilling Data Center and interfacing with stakeholders from across the company, the candidate will independently create actionable reports, algorithms, and models that will directly impact company efficiency of onshore drilling operations and contribute to development of new technologies. The candidate will be responsible for managing all aspects of the team’s projects, including interviewing stakeholders to better understand underlying systems for analysis, cleaning and analyzing data, generating visuals and reports, and presenting results to stakeholders in a way that is clear and actionable. The ideal candidate would be a team player and leader, possess advanced data science skills, expert in working with large data sets in Python, think analytically and perform complex calculations, and be able to communicate clearly with numerous stakeholders of varying backgrounds across the company.
This role performs under general direction of the Director, Drilling Optimization and Data Center.
Detailed Description:
Manage and lead a team of data analysts working on different data science and analytics projects
Hire, mentor and train data analysts. Establish standards and guidelines for the team
Become the subject matter expert on the projects, mentor and coach team members on coding, visualization and project related queries
Quickly learn aspects of the drilling process and equipment to efficiently derive insights from our data
Be proactive and seek out buy-in for our analytics tools within the company
Be the focal point for analytics: work and communicate with multiple stakeholders, understand project requirements, and deliver analytics solutions
Track, analyze and act on KPI’s to improve drilling operations and communicate improvements
Assist with developing and improving our suite of data analytics applications and visualizations, including developing requirements and working with developers
Execute in parallel multiple analytics projects of varying complexity and data sources (~1 week to ~3 months; time series and relational databases)
Independently manage and execute above projects from start-to-finish, including understanding stakeholder needs; acquiring necessary data; cleaning / analyzing data and innovating beyond initial requirements; generating visuals / reports; and presenting results to stakeholders
Develop, deploy, and sustain real-time algorithms and models over time-series and relational database data with minimal memory and processing impact. Models will be integrated into cloud and edge-based architectures to model equipment health, human behavior, and optimal drilling practices
Job Requirements
Prior experience or ability to quickly learn the details of oil and gas drilling
Experience leading a team of highly skilled data analysts, providing coaching and guidance to them through design and development of advanced algorithms
Have excellent soft skills to gain rapport within the organization and seek out buy-in for our analytics team
Able to articulate complex data science techniques to end-users that have minimum technical background
Experience working closely with multiple with product teams in the office as needed
Expert in programming to generate analyses, algorithms, and visuals
Able to generate complex visualizations and analyses quickly in a workshop environment
Able to work both independently and as part of a team, managing multiple tasks and projects simultaneously to meet challenging deadlines
Able to think strategically and translate concepts into action plans and track results
Comfortable explaining complex analytics concepts and results to end-users
Excellent verbal and written English Language communication
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
2+ years’ leading/managing data analytics teams and complex data science projects
5+ years’ experience in Python for data analysis (including Jupyter Notebooks, Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib)
2+ years’ experience in SQL and knowledgeable in general database design
2+ years’ experience in analyzing and visualizing large time series data sets
2+ years’ experience in developing Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence solutions (SKLearn, Tensorflow / Pytorch)
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree or higher in Engineering, Data Science/Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
Previous work in the oil and gas industry
Previous experience working in cross-functional roles and communicating directly with product users
Experience with big data architectures (Hadoop, Spark)

positionName: Managing Data Analyst, Gas and Power Modeling
description:
The Role: S&P Global Platts is seeking a Manager, Gas and Power Modeling, to support the fundamental and price forecasts for Platts Analytics Generating Fuels business. Reporting to the Head of Modeling, Platts Analytics, you will focus on supporting the runtime, development, and lifecycle management of a suite of models for global natural gas, coal, and power markets. This role will leverage your detailed knowledge of statistical and quantitative modeling techniques, energy market knowledge, and also draw on your team management and leadership skills. This role will also play a key role in successfully migrating existing models from legacy assets to our new Data Science Workbench while delivering new models that add value to Platts Analytics products.

Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 12

The Location: Denver, Houston

The vision: To create a single enterprise-grade tool for company-wide data exploration, modeling and generation of insights, consolidating legacy models and preparing Platts to exploit the power of machine learning.

The Team: Reporting to the Head of Modeling, the successful candidate will work collaboratively with the content analysts, business partners, and other teams within Modeling and Data Science to transform the data and modeling processes and products.

The Impact: The successful candidate will combine an understanding of the S&P Global Platts Analytics business and data strategy with our goal to streamline and automate content ingestion, storage, modeling and distribution through multiple channels to Platts external customers. They will also be able to work well in a team, be highly self-motivated as well as able to execute independently when required. This is a leadership role with a reporting structure, so the candidate will also have strong leadership and people management qualities.

The position plays a key role to our company’s successful design and management of predictive models that feed data products and Analytics research, insights, and presentations through setting and meeting Model Governance controls.

Responsibilities : The Modeling and Data Science Team works closely with the Analytics Content Team to collect, clean, enrich, and model data sets which are delivered as data products and used by the Analytics Team to generate insights and analysis for reports, presentations, and research. The Modelling Team is responsible for collaborating with subject matter experts in Analytics to research, design, develop, and implement models that improve the value of our Analytics services. This also includes measuring, monitoring, and improving model performance.

Lead and manage a team through transformational organizational, process and workflow, and technology changes
Expand the team’s data science capabilities to include NLP, neural networks, and other useful data science techniques to better capitalize on automation and forecasting opportunities
Design and implement strategic workflow processes that are scalable, meets the requirements for Model Governance principles, and optimizes the throughput of model development while continuously measuring and improving on model accuracy
Work closely with stakeholders to modernize existing models while delivering on new models that support the business’s growth strategy
Partner with our offshore team to establish around the clock support for models and to help execute the roadmap
Collaborate closely with Analytics Content Team to support models through existing legacy processes until those processes can be migrated to new platforms
Ensure team executes with discipline and delivers on Model Governance expectations
Be pro-active in identifying opportunities for modeling and workflow requirements for the new Analytics platform
Develop training programs for new and existing staff members to develop skills required for our new workflows
Manage workload and priorities through Agile way of working

What we’re looking for:
An experienced Manager, Gas and Power Modeling, with a track record of designing models leveraging modern technology to automate workflows, experience with a wide variety of methodologies to solve a variety of modeling challenges, and practice deploying models to production through a CI/CD process
Strong leadership and people management qualities
Experience working with data and understanding of the role modeled data plays in our Analytics services
A proven track record of delivering projects in collaborative Agile team environments
The ability to present to senior business and technical audiences commanding sufficient subject matter expertise
Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects and stakeholders simultaneously and under tight deadlines is important
A strong collaborator and communicator

Basic Qualifications:
BA/BS in engineering, economics, computer science, data science, or related discipline
8+ years of experience with data, data automation, databases, or analytics technologies
5+ years developing predictive models leveraging a variety of modeling techniques
Experience working in the commodities sector, with a strong understanding of the Analytics business
Understanding of cloud-based services, preferably AWS
Familiarity with software development life cycle practices
Proficient with Python, R, or MATLAB

Preferred Qualifications:
Proven ability to interface well with IT staff and other non-technical members of the organization
A professional, highly dedicated, detail-oriented, and energetic personality, with the ability to work and thrive in a team environment
Demonstrated ability to create and deliver creative solutions and automated workflows
Demonstrable, directly related data, modeling, or data science experience
Excellent presentation skills. Ability to take on internal presentations to all levels of the organization

Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):
S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $46,200 to $95,900. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.
In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires .

At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.

S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com .

S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy (“the Policy”) that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. The Policy is designed to promote compliance with global regulations. In some Divisions, pursuant to the Policy’s requirements, candidates at S&P Global may be asked to disclose securities holdings. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world's most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.
Banking Technology supports technology for 3 parts of the Banking business under CIB, namely Global Investment Banking (GIB), Global Corporate Banking (GCB), and Treasury Services (TS). GIB works with a broad range of issuer clients, including corporations, institutions and governments, and provides comprehensive strategic advice, capital raising and risk management expertise. GCB manages the firm's relationships with large corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations globally to help our clients meet their objectives and challenges in financing, risk management, working capital, cash management and investments. TS delivers cash management, trade, liquidity, commercial card and escrow services that resolve the working capital and efficiency challenges treasury professionals face today.
Be part of Banking Technology in JPMorgan:
This is a Technical Business Analyst role within the GIB / GCB Technology team. You will join an inspiring and curious team of business analysts defining and designing our core deal lifecycle management platform, working with a team delivering a world-class technology solution, providing deal lifecycle efficiencies, analytics, business intelligence & controls for the world's #1 investment banking franchise, impacting thousands of users and generating $billions of revenue annually. You'll be working with and sharing ideas, information, and innovation with our global team; we are based predominantly in Houston, NYC, and London but also maintain a presence in Mumbai, and the businesses we support span the globe. Travel is not, however, required for this role.
Responsibilities

Solid understanding of Domain Driven Design (DDD) including, but not limited to, context maps, context cards, etc.
Basic understanding of microserivces, data management and anti-corruption layers (ACLs)
Creation of the activity flow diagrams for different use cases, including clear segregation of functionality based on the context
Creation of user stories with very clear description and greater level of detail including input and output fields, all the use cases (positive and negative), leveraging techniques like spec by example, Gherkin syntax, or other structured specification approaches
Review functional solution designs with Architects and collaborating with engineering teams to agree API's, interactions etc. where required
Detailed understanding & experience of end-to-end software development frameworks like Agile, Scrum
Mapping functional requirements to components to enable common solution design across the platform.
Engagement with Product Owner to ensure that requirements are sufficiently communicated to enable technical design, estimation and build:
Verification that use cases cover identified flows
Gap analysis of changes required

Interested? This is what you should have:

BS/BA degree or equivalent
At least 10 years of experience in a business analyst or equivalent role with 5 years involvement in understanding business requirements
Hands on experience in the functional design of complex enterprise systems
Basic understanding of SQL queries and Microsoft products (viz, excel, visio, word and powerpoint)
Experience in managing senior business stakeholders in global context
Track record in working with stakeholders in different geographies
A commercial mind-set to deliver short, medium and long term strategies to achieve sustained efficiency; an innovative thought process; focus on simplification;
An exciting opportunity to influence and shape the products that bankers interact on a daily basis
Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

positionName: Business Intelligence Analyst in the Office of the CIO
company: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth)
description:
Position Summary:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to help support our Chief Information Officer and the financial area of UTHealth that deals with technology. This employee must apply a user-centered approach to transform raw data into meaningful and useful information, which will enable more effective, strategic, tactical, and operational insight and decision-making. You will need to be very skilled in creating reports and offering analytics around them. Applicants that have used Epic or PeopleSoft before are preferred, although this is not a requirement. SQL Database would also be a plus to have experience in. Yet the core of this role is to work in a reporting capacity for an area that is focused on financials.

This is a full time position which is eligible for all benefits from UTHealth including excellent healthcare coverage as well as a pension administered by the State of Texas. You will office in the Texas Medical Center at our University Center Tower. It is classified as salaried and exempt.

Position Key Accountabilities:
1. Analyze and make recommendations for project implementations and maintenance. Must understand the data available in applicable business systems and be able to write queries. Deliver recommendations, improvement plans, as well as training materials.
2. Assist in the development and ongoing reporting of performance metrics and benchmarking, keeping our business leaders and key constituents informed of our progress towards business goals.
3. Supports timely flow of business intelligence information to users by meeting deadlines and being responsive to requests.
4. Provide technical support for existing reports, dashboards or other tools. In addition, maintains excellent documentation of systems and report methodologies. Supports the maintenance of a library of model documents, templates or other reusable knowledge assets.
5. Communicate with internal customers, suppliers and others to stay abreast of industry or business trends. In addition, use effective communication and problem-solving techniques to facilitate team performance.
6. Conduct quality testing to ensure accuracy of data reported.
7. Serves as a liaison between Management and Technology project teams.
8. Other duties as needed.
Certification/Skills:
Experience defining metrics, dimensions and KPI’s on Business Intelligence projects
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Access
Strong critical thinking, analytic and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and effectively with prudent judgment and discretion at all times.
Experience with Cognos, Oracle and SQL database reporting tools preferred as is experience with PeopleSoft or Epic
Experience in working with large volumes of data preferred.

Minimum Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Science, Business or related field required.

Minimum Experience:
Three (3) years of system analysis, technical design, development and/or implementation experience, which includes 1 year of experience working with healthcare operations strongly preferred. May substitute required experience with equivalent years of education beyond the minimum education requirement.

Physical Requirements:
Exerts up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to 10 pounds frequently and/or a negligible amount constantly to move objects.

Security Sensitive:
This job class may contain positions that are security sensitive and thereby subject to the provisions of Texas Education Code § 51.215

Company Overview

Crown Castle works around the country to build and maintain the infrastructure behind the world’s most revolutionary technologies. As the largest shared infrastructure provider in the United States, Crown Castle owns, operates and leases more than 40,000 cell towers, 80,000 small cells and over 80,000 route miles of fiber across every major US market. This nationwide portfolio of communications infrastructure connects cities and communities to essential data, technology and wireless service – bringing information, ideas and innovations to the people and businesses that need them. Crown Castle is a NYSE S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company and one of the largest Real Estate Investment Trusts in the United States with an enterprise value of approximately $100 billion.

Position Title: Business Analyst (4E)

Position Summary

 The Business Analyst works as part of a cross-functional team to identify business needs and define potential solutions. These solutions may consist of business process improvements as well as information systems components. The successful candidate will work closely with various members of Real Estate Acquisitions (REA) to streamline processes and enhance technical systems. They will gather requirements from the business to translate and interface on with the technical development organization.


Essential Job Functions

Complete process reviews, model business process, and develop process maps.
Work with representatives from the various lines of business to identify process improvement opportunities and to assist in developing potential solutions.
Decompose business and user requirements into requirements specifications to a level of detail suitable for use by those that must base their work on the requirements.
Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely.
Participate in peer reviews of work products and documents.
Manage assigned projects to completion, ensuring that all activities are coordinated and completed on time and within budget. Track and report project progress, using standard methods and procedures to monitor critical project issues.
Facilitate internal meetings with managers and other team members.
Ensure proper and effective communication regarding process changes. Assist with the development of training as necessary.
Act as a liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.


Education/Certifications

High school diploma or equivalent
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Analytics, Finance, Tech, MIS or related field preferred


Experience/Minimum Requirements

Minimum of two (2) + years of experience in the analysis and development of business processes and in the writing of functional requirements supporting systems development
Possess an understanding of established process development and improvement and agile systems development methodologies
Foundational understanding of the Crown business model and the telecommunications industry


Other Skills/Abilities

Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Understanding of metrics and their use to drive behavior and process change
Knowledge of the Information Systems development process (e.g. Requirements Definition, User Testing, etc…)
Ability to build and maintain relationships across cross-functional teams and to work effectively in a matrix organization
Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
Experience working in PowerBI and Oracle preferred

positionName: Business Intelligence Developer / Analyst - Remote - USA
description:
FullStack Labs is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.
We’re most proud of:Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies.Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.Our 4.7-star rating on GlassDoor.Our client Net Promoter Score of 64, twice the industry average.Sustained growth of 100% - 200% per year.
The Position:
We're looking to hire several mid-level to senior BI developers. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways:
Team Augmentation / Staffing: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.
Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.
Primary responsibilities will include:
Work with clients to analyze their data and processes so you can build dashboards to expose their KPIs
You will provide solutions to organizational difficulties and identify areas to help improve the company’s bottom line
You will play a major role in improving decision-making and resource optimization.
You will understand their business model and strategies, and utilize a number of data sources and analytical techniques to provide the company with insights concisely and effectively
Gathering detailed requirements from the Client for building cubes
Interact with Business and IT stakeholders to gather requirements for building a multi-dimensional cube
Design and develop multi-dimensional cubes and tabular models as per industry standards to satisfy business requirements
Collaborate with Business and get sign-off on the developed components
Connect to data sources, import data, and transform data for Business Intelligence
Implement row-level data security and application security-layer models in Power BI and Tableau
Develop responsive, intuitive, and visually stunning dashboards and reports in both Power BI and Tableau
Integrate Power BI and Tableau reports into other applications using embedded analytics like Power BI service (SaaS), API automation, and JavaScript/React Web
What We're Looking For:
Should have experience in creating database architectures and Looker.
Should have experience in developing and managing Azure SQL Data Warehouse-based system.
Should have sound experience in creating multidimensional cubes and Tabular models.
Customer-facing with strong communication skills.
2+ years experience working with Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, SQL data warehouse, and PostgreSQL.
3+ years experience building and administering ETL, Analysis Services, tabular, and multi-dimensional reporting models using Power BI, Tableau, SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS that are compatible with data-warehousing industry standards.
3+ years experience generating reporting solutions including Power BI and Tableau.
Demonstrated expertise using advanced-level calculations on data sets including the use of PowerQuery, M, R, and DAX.
Excellent analytical thinking demonstrated by translating data into informative visual reports, dashboards, and KPI scorecards in Power BI and Tableau.
A four-year college degree is required, with a BS/MS in Computer Science or Information Systems preferred.
Familiarity with JavaScript, CSS, React Web, and other JavaScript libraries desired.
Strong work ethic and the ability to focus and single-task throughout the day.
Ability to work well with team members within an agile development team.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Benefits:
Competitive Salary
Paid Time Off (vacation, sick leave, maternity and paternity leave, holidays)
100% remote work, now and post COVID.
The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies
Health, dental, vision insurance
401k w/ 4% match
Virtual company events each month
Ample opportunity for career advancement
Continuing education opportunities

positionName: Sr Analyst - Crude Trucking Data Services
description:
Summary
This position will be responsible for the daily audit / reconciliation of crude trucking delivery stations. This position is within the Measurement Department and will be responsible for providing support to operations and other related disciplines with measurement analytics and activities. The position will require working with field personnel, measurement specialists, marketers, accounting, and both internal and external counterparties.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Daily/Weekly
Reconciliation and daily audit of crude oil stations comparing truck ticket receipts to delivery data.
Audit run ticket data to verify accuracy and ensure accurate data is transmitted to accounting and other parties.
Review, resolve, and approve exception reporting for assigned truck stations.
Utilize measurement data system tools and reports to analyze volumes to ensure accuracy and determine gain loss activity.
Create, review, and distribute various analytical information and reports needed to validate the accuracy of measurement data.
Review, research, and resolve gain loss issues at assigned truck stations.
Provide gain loss support to accounting, product movement, field measurement and operations personnel in the tracking and resolution of custody transfer issues in compliance with applicable SOX and internal measurement specifications, codes, safety standards and operating procedures.
Validate and reconcile truck run tickets against station data to identify missing or duplicate tickets and review any volume variance discrepancies.
Work in conjunction with third party carriers and terminals to ensure timely and accurate measurement data exchange.
Work with field measurement operations to prepare and provide current and historical station volume information for troubleshooting and to resolve balance issues.
Monthly
Post-close analysis of delivery locations that actualize outside of acceptable gain loss variances.
Reconciliation of transaction types other than truck run tickets such as BuySell, Pipeline, and Bulk tickets.

Additional
Assist/Lead internal projects as assigned by management.
This position is part of a team that relies on open communication.

Requirements:
Education and/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
At least 2 years of relevant experience
Prior audit experience and / or industry specific knowledge is preferred
Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must have an aptitude for analyzing data.
Must have good communications skills and work well with other stakeholders.
Self-starter with the ability to manage multiple tasks with limited supervision.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where priorities may shift rapidly.
Microsoft Office with enhanced Excel skills preferred

Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:
The Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 2-5 years of relevant job related experience
The Senior Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 5-8 years of relevant job related experience

Working Conditions:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
Usually, normal office working conditions.
Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time due to prolonged periods of sitting or standing.
Occasional overnight travel may be required.
Occasional visits to industrial/manufacturing settings, which may include exposure to various materials and chemicals, as well as extreme temperature conditions and loud machinery, and require appropriate personal protective equipment.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet

Accenture Strategy & Consulting, Utility Industry, Retail Energy and Customer Service Practice helps energy providers around the world to reimagine, transform and grow their business and create new value propositions, revenue streams, commercial models and ecosystems. We are the marketplace leader in modernizing the Customer Experience network, delivering next level of connectivity between marketing, operations and technology that goes beyond the commodity. Our utility clients are looking for bold solutions in the era of rapidly changing technology, policy and workforce innovations. Are you the leader who wants to reinvent the Utilities' Customer Experience and empower our clients to create a clean, sustainable and connected world? Join a team of industry practitioners with global footprint and local camaraderie. Visit our site to learn more about Accenture Strategy & Consulting Utilities Practice.

positionName: Data and Analytics Consultant - Remote/WFH Option
description:
Data and Analytics Consultant
Location: Houston, TX
Type: Full Time
**Remote applicants will be considered if they are accessible to our customers.
About KiZAN
KiZAN Technologies, a Microsoft Gold Partner for twenty-seven years, is always on the lookout for the best and brightest talent. As a gold-certified and managed Microsoft partner, KiZAN allows business leaders to focus on the vision, not the technology. We provide strategic planning, application, and infrastructure services for Healthcare, Manufacturing, Financial Services, Retail, Professional Services, helping companies identify and solve business problems and take advantage of opportunities using innovative technologies, demonstrated consulting expertise and proven project management. Our clients range from mid-sized organizations to enterprise corporations, and they represent a variety of industries. Combining world-class products with our commitment to excellence has enabled us to be the local and regional technology solution provider of choice.

As a company, we exist to enable everyone to follow their passion. We succeed by attracting, developing, empowering, and promoting quality people; we embrace, kaizen, and evangelize processes; and place high value on continuous learning, creativity and an entrepreneurial spirit. As a team, we strive to create Raving Fans with our clients, as well as our employees. KiZAN provides a family culture, has received the Alfred P. Sloan Award for Workplace Flexibility multiple years, and encourages a fun environment by providing "just because" events for our family to get together outside of the workplace.

KiZAN Technologies has an immediate need for an exceptional individual to join our family as a Data and Analytics Consultant. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, is a true team player with a commitment to success, has leadership skills, and will be able to thrive in a fast paced, rapidly-changing environment.

Responsibilities
As a Consultant on our Business Intelligence and Analytics team, you will work closely with clients to define and deliver business intelligence and analytics solutions using Microsoft SQL Server and Power BI technologies. The Consultant provides guidance and hands-on technical expertise in designing and building solutions that unlock the value of data for our clients. The Consultant works both independently and as part of a project team on a variety of solutions, such as database design, data integration, data warehousing, business intelligence, data visualization, and others.
Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
Implement data warehousing, reporting, business intelligence and analytics solutions
Design, deploy and administer business analytics solutions using Power BI
Create both paginated and interactive reports
Create dashboards and scorecards
Create ETL processes using SSIS, Azure Data Factory and similar tools
Design and implement relational databases
Assist in creating tabular models using Analysis Services and/or Power BI
Provide input in database design and review sessions
Troubleshoot existing BI solutions
Identify and strive to realize desired business outcomes from customer engagements
Manage successful completion of project initiatives on-time and within budget
Transfer knowledge to customers as part of the delivery of services and through classroom instruction
As the client's trusted advisor, identify and pursue additional opportunities to provide value
Communicate with clients about project status, handle customer concerns, involving Practice Lead or Project Manager as needed
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information systems, business, mathematics, engineering or equivalent work experience
2+ years building data warehousing, business intelligence and analytics solutions using Microsoft technologies
Proficiency with Power BI (1+ years of work experience)
Proficiency with SQL Server or cloud-based databases services with strong T-SQL development skills (2+ years of work experience)
Proficiency with data integration tools, such as SSIS or Azure Data Factory (1+ years of work experience)
Proficiency with paginated report development using SSRS (1+ years of work experience)
Proficiency in Excel
Strong track record of Business Intelligence solution development
Ability to travel, overnight up to 25%
Ability to travel independently to client sites; if by car, a valid driver's license or reliable method of transportation is required
Authorization to work in the U.S. without sponsorship
Skills and Abilities
Strong analytical, design, data modeling and problem-solving skills
Ability to show initiative and work independently in a self-reliant manner with minimal supervision
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply appropriately to business situations
Strong team player who enjoys working in a fast-paced team atmosphere
Ability to balance team and individual responsibilities
Ability to work under pressure; meet strict deadlines
Ability to listen effectively and seek clarification
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English. Must be able to effectively and comfortably communicate with all types of individuals from the customer technical expert to the customer executive management
Preferred Experience, Skills and Abilities
Experience with Power BI adoption, administration and governance
Knowledge of dimensional modeling and database optimization techniques
Knowledge of ETL and report development best practices and optimization techniques
Experience with SSAS and proficiency in DAX and/or MDX
Experience with developing data and analytics solutions in Azure, using such technologies as Azure SQL Databases, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Azure Stream Analytics, Azure HDInsight, Azure Machine Learning and others
Work experience in a consultant capacity
Knowledge of Agile/SCRUM SDLC Methodologies
Microsoft Certifications in Database Development, Database Administration, Business Intelligence, or related fields.

EEO/AA Employer

positionName: VP Business Analyst Commodities Risk Technology
description:
T
Background
The role is for a VP Business Analyst within the Commodities Technology Front Office Risk team in Houston.
Citi are now one of the largest Commodities players in the banking sector, having grown rapidly over the past five years and we have ambitious plans to further develop our proprietary Commodities platform. Our technology challenges are therefore fast-moving and varied.
The team develops and supports a strategic platform which calculates, manages and stores intra-day and EOD risk data for front office trading and we need to increase the size of our team to support build out of the US Oil, Gas and Power trading operation.
Our roles offer motivated candidates the chance to engage with our trading, quants and sales teams in an agile way and learn the vital role that risk plays across a wide range of commodities financial and physical products and we offer the chance to gain experience of real-time pricing and risk techniques.
Responsibilities
Interface directly with traders, sales and quants to gather and define business requirements.
Contribute to the re-engineering. development and enhancement of a wide range of risk management tools.
Adhere to and continuously improve our processes and SDLC in a fast moving environment.
Knowledge / Experience
Knowledge of Commodities risk processes ( Front Office or downstream ).
Knowledge of Commodities products and trade lifecycle particularly Oil, Gas and Power.
Experience with OpenLink preferred but not essential.
Team leading and stakeholder management potential.
Experience dealing with Quant libraries.
Experience in Python preferred.

AECOM is seeking a Sr. IT Business Analyst to support our Corporate IT team. This will be a remote/virtual position that can be based from a variety of locations in the US.

Consults and partners with business and IT to implement business process changes for AECOM. Supports the System/Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) for projects impacting various business units and functional areas within AECOM. Performs the full range of business analysis tasks including process mapping, requirements definition, IT testing, oversight of user testing, and end user training. Responsible for understanding impact of projects and system changes on business processes and working with business resources to facilitate a smooth transition. Works with Project Manager to ensure high quality delivery within time, cost, and quality parameters.

Responsibilities:
+ Documents functional and non-functional system requirements; develops test cases and step-by-step test procedures for enterprise-scale projects

+ Works closely with business managers, demand managers and end users to understand their processes and procedures

+ Identifies new innovative solutions to optimize business processes, reduce costs, and/or enhance the customer experience

+ Works with the business and IT to gather and document scope and requirements for technology initiatives

+ Performs as-is and to-be process mapping and gap analysis, requirements definition, system demos, IT testing, oversight of user testing, and end user training

+ Prepares project documentation including requirements documentation, test scripts/use cases, process maps, wireframes, user training materials, standard operating procedures (SOPs), user communications, and change control documentation

+ Ensures compliance of projects/solutions with key AECOM controls (e.g., Sarbanes Oxley)

+ Assists with defining the support model for new systems and facilitates transition of the new system from project resources to support resources

+ Assesses impact of projects/systems on business processes and facilitates a smooth transition of system and process changes to ensure minimal business disruption

+ May participate in evaluation and selection of vendors/solutions including management of proposal/RFP process

+ Assists with development of various management/executive presentations to present process improvement solutions, business case, and project progress.

+ Gather and translate business requirements into product backlog User Stories. Create and maintain business requirements in the form of user stories with appropriate acceptance criteria.

+ Collaborate with the Project Manager, Product Owner(s), Project Team, ScrumMaster (where applicable) and/or Business Stakeholders to confirm/understand clear business objectives, processes, and metrics for input into User Story definition and prioritization.

+ Facilitate User Story mapping sessions with Business Stakeholders, as needed.

+ Facilitate and schedule project or scrum meetings, as needed.

+ Facilitate collaborative team discussions via project communication channels for a distributed team (e.g. Microsoft Teams).

+ Train end users on new application features, as needed.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

+ Strong analytical, problem solving, and technical skills

+ Strategic thinker with the ability to recognize, analyze, and recommend solutions to system, analytical and interpersonal problems throughout the SDLC

+ Strong planning, organizing, and coordinating skills

+ Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills with ability to communicate technical issues to non-technical individuals

+ Solid facilitation skills with business and technical participants

+ Strong time management skills

+ Ability to easily adapt to a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment

+ Effective speaking and meeting facilitation skills

+ Well-rounded technical experience with solid understanding of common technologies and solutions, both infrastructure and applications

+ Applications/software project experience, including requirements and testing for custom cloud-based and mobile application software development or configuration of off-the-shelf solutions

+ Business Analyst experience working on projects using Agile/Scrum, Strong Requirements and Testing experience including process mapping, requirements definition, testing documentation, IT testing, coordinate user testing, and training

+ Proficient in using full Microsoft Office, Microsoft Visio, Agile methodology, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, Jira, Confluence and Archer

About AECOM

At AECOM, we believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

We take on the most complex challenges and pioneer innovative, iconic solutions that push the limits of what’s possible – the world’s longest cable-stayed bridge, record-breaking sports events, the largest greenfield port development mega project, life-sustainingdisaster recovery programs, and the tallest tower in the Western Hemisphere.

On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, energy and the environment, we deliver professional services throughout the project lifecycle.

We are proud to be recognized for excellence:
+ Named one of _Fortune_ magazine's "World's Most Admired Companies" for the sixth consecutive year

+ Ranked #1 in _Engineering News-Record_ ’s 2020 “Top 200 Environmental Firms”

+ Ranked #1 in Transportation and General Building in _Engineering News-Record_ ’s 2020 “Top 500 Design Firms”

+ VIQTORY 2020 Military Friendly® Gold Employer

+ Offered rate of compensation will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The midpoint of the salary range is $97,153.00 annually.

+ AECOM is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits program to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D and disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absence, retirement benefits, voluntary benefits, perks, wellness and global well-being, and global EAP, Business Travel and Service Awards programs.

Minimum Requirements

+ BA/BS plus 6 years of relevant experience in Business, Requirements, Problem Solving or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education

Preferred Qualifications

+ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science

+ BA certification

+ CSM

+ PowerBI, Oracle experience

+ Archer administration expertise

Additional Information:
+ Sponsorship for US work Authorization is not available for this position.

+ Due to the remote nature of this position, relocation assistance is not available.

What We Offer

When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future. Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world, but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Overview:

Baker Tilly US, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a leading advisory, tax and assurance firm, providing clients a genuine coast-to-coast and global advantage with critical mass and top-notch talent in major regions of the U.S. and in many of the world’s leading financial centers – New York, London, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Chicago. Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 148 territories, with 36,000 professionals and a combined worldwide revenue of $4.0 billion.
Many of Baker Tilly’s roles have the opportunity to work remotely. Please discuss with your talent acquisition professional to understand the requirements for an opportunity you are exploring.
Baker Tilly is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable federal, state or local law.
Responsibilities:

Do you thrive in an environment where technology can transform a customer’s day to day?
Are you interested in joining one of the fastest growing professional services firms in the nation?
If yes, consider joining Baker Tilly US, LLP (BT) as an Accounting Systems Business Analyst! At BT your main responsibilities will include working directly with the developers, project managers and customers to define and translate functional business requirements into software solutions with high customer satisfaction and successful customer adoption.
As one of the fastest growing firms in the nation, BT has the ability to offer you upward career trajectory, flexibility in how and where you get your work done and meaningful relationships with clients, teammates and leadership who truly care about you and your development.
Does this describe you?
You want to work for a leading professional services firm whose owners have both their clients’ and employees’ best interests in mind and are transparent in their decisions
You want to grow professionally and develop your client service and technical skills to build a career with endless opportunities now, for tomorrow
What you will do:
Be a trusted member of the engagement team and responsible for:
Managing multiple customers simultaneously to successfully design and support the development of software solutions resulting in high customer satisfaction and successful customer adoption
Gathering requirements in collaboration with key client stakeholders, define requirements, design solutions, communicate with development team, test unit and integrations, train, and support transition to the professional services team
Maintaining deep knowledge of the Sage Intacct software including understanding of the core and advanced modules, as well as staying current with the latest product features and enhancements
Defining and supporting the roll-out of specially developed solutions that integrate with the Sage Intacct software based on a thorough understanding of customer-specific business processes as well as industry and system best practices
Developing and communicating project plans while supporting the on-time delivery and on budget execution
Conducting training for customer end-users at all levels of the organization and relate system functionality to customer business requirements
Effectively documenting customer business requirements into software solutions and business management processes utilizing BTs best practices
Responding to customer technical support issues related to the system implementation of newly developed solutions
Working closely in a team-oriented and collaborate environment with Professional Services, Sales, Support, Marketing and Customer Success to effectively coordinate project execution and completion
Delivering prompt, concise, and friendly communications while providing high quality service and leadership to align with customer goals and requests
Contributing to and use knowledge repository of deployment best practices and enhancing tools and repeatability of service delivery
Serving as an escalation point for project issues
Learn and grow from direct on the job coaching and mentoring along with participating in firm wide learning and development programs
Utilize your entrepreneurial skills to network and build strong relationships internally and with your clients
Support the growth and development of team members through the Baker Tilly Care and Teach philosophy, helping associates meet their professional goals
Enjoy friendships, social activities and team outings that encourage a work-life balance
Qualifications:

Successful candidates will have:
A bachelor's degree required, preferably in accounting, MIS or computer science
One (1)+ years’ experience consulting and implementing Sage Intacct, ERP/financial applications, or other SaaS solutions and/or experience as a business analyst working with core accounting and finance software
Consulting or business analyst experience communicating with customers or end users and technical development staff on system issues, modifications, and new software deployment desired
Ability to deploy advanced business analytics skills solving complex problems and interpreting customer requirements into deliverable solutions
Experience in assessing client requirements across a broad array of business processes
Programming/coding experience a nice-to-have for translating business requirements into technical solutions and being able to “speak the language” of technology
Advanced proficiency with Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP’s, macros, etc.) is a nice-to-have for efficient data mapping, integration, and migration of customer data
Experience supporting or using Sage Intacct is a differentiator
Demonstrated skills in the areas of time management, communication, interpersonal skills, relationship building, collaboration, and problem solving
Strong leadership, project management, organizational and analytical skills, initiative, adaptability
Microsoft Suite skills
Eligibility to work in the U.S. without sponsorship preferred

Create dashboards and interactive visual reports using Power BI, CRM, & SQL.

Maintain cylinder tracking data integrity.
Understand the order to cash business processes and system interactions.
