Title: Technical Business Analyst

Classification: Administrative/Professional

Exemption Status/Test: Exempt

Job Grade: 3

Department: Information Technology Solutions

Reports To: Director
Job Goal:
Collaborate with stakeholders to define and address business requirements. The Technical

Business Analyst will serve as the liaison between customers and our development team to

collect, clearly document and communicate both technical and non-technical information,

ensuring that the delivered solution satisfies business requirements.
Qualifications:
Education
Bachelor’s Degree
Experience
1. 2 years of working in a Service Desk environment or support role to track and solve

customer requests through remediation
2. 2 years of experience with testing solutions by defining acceptance criteria and hands-on

experience testing solutions from development to production (automated or non-
automated means)
3. 3 years of project-related experience in supporting and improving enterprise applications

through streamlining processes using SWOT, Business Process Modeling (BPM) flows, or

other techniques to find efficiencies
4. Experience with requirements analysis and ability differentiate between technical and non-
functional requirements
Special Knowledge and Skills
1. Outstanding collaboration skills

2. Strong computer, IT operations or software background

3. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including the ability communicate
highly technical concepts to a non-technical audience

4. Solid critical thinking and analysis skills, including being able to define the “What” and
“How” of a situation and understand the risks, rewards and opportunities presented to

stakeholders
5. Excellent problem-solving skills

6. High level of organizational skills and attention to detail

Preferred Experience and Qualifications
1. 3 years of experience as a technical business analyst

2. Working knowledge of agile methodologies

3. Working knowledge of AWS or Amazon tools for development

4. Technical or development experience in full stack development

5. Experience using JIRA or Microsoft Azure DevOps for agile development
Major Responsibilities:
1. Primary contact between customers and development team to ensure smooth transfer of

information and a timely and accurate response.
2. Define and develop User Story requirements following agile methodology.

3. Document user stories, features, and acceptance criteria in Microsoft Azure DevOps as
required by the organization.

4. Develop and maintain subject matter expertise on platform and technologies used within
the organization.

5. Facilitate meetings and scrum sessions with internal and external customers who require
assistance to define and solve bugs, user stories, or features.

6. Develop creative and innovative technological solutions to business challenges and
requirements.

7. Communicate, translate and simplify business requirements to ensure buy-in from both
internal and external customers.

8. Perform some development within toolsets of AWS framework, Angular, React, SQL, NOSQL
and working with DevOps team assisting where needed for tasks to solve bugs, features or

user stories. (Training can be provided)

Supervisory Responsibilities:
None
Physical Demands/Environmental Factors/ Mental Demands:
Frequent use of standard office equipment; prolonged sitting; occasional bending/stooping,

pushing/pulling, and twisting; repetitive hand motions (keyboarding and use of mouse);

occasional lifting and carrying (up to 15 pounds); may work prolonged and irregular hours;

work with frequent interruptions; maintain emotional control under pressure.
This document describes the general purpose and responsibilities assigned to this job and is not an

exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties that may be assigned or skills that may be required.

positionName: Business Solutions Analyst III, Power BI
description:
Equal Opportunity Employer: Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran

WM, a Fortune 250 company, is the leading provider of comprehensive waste and environmental services in North America. We are strongly committed to a foundation of operating excellence, professionalism and financial strength. WM serves nearly 21 million customers in residential, commercial, industrial and municipal markets throughout North America through a network of collection operations, transfer stations, landfills, recycling facilities and renewable energy projects.
Why join our team?

At WM, we believe that the proud, caring, resilient members of the WM family are the foundation for our success. As such, we commit to taking care of each other, our customers, our communities, and the environment. We believe in "Success with Integrity"- essentially, Doing the Right Thing, the Right Way. We commit to being accountable, honest, trustworthy, ethical, and compliant in all that we do.
I. Job Summary
Recognized across the organization for business expertise and sought as a resource for resolution of unique or complex business problem and the development of solutions for new business opportunities. Provides a high level of business expertise while conducting complex business process analyses, needs assessments, and preliminary cost/benefit analyses to align business solutions with the company strategy and initiatives. Designs and develops metrics reporting, dashboards, etc. using WM standard data analytics tools.
II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the assigned essential duties satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned, and duties may vary by department.
Works with management, and individual team leaders by contributing strategic vison and integrating a broad range of ideas regarding organization metrics and reporting models that guide continuous improvement.
Coordinates and integrates multiple enterprise solutions projects with a large scope and complexity in an environment for business change.
Contributes high level expertise in business processes and systems analysis while considering the business implications to the current and future business environment.
Responsible for deliverables, cost, schedule and quality of one or more enterprise solutions projects.
Plans projects, allocates and directs less experienced staff and other resources to accomplish project tasks, participates on cross-functional project teams.
Works with internal and external customers, suppliers and other partners to resolve problems, respond to suggestions for improvement and enhancements, test, refine and institutionalize solutions.
Drives the project(s) and the organization toward achieving business results.
May act as a source of direction, training and guidance for less experienced staff demonstrating coaching, mentoring, and leadership skills

III. Supervisory Responsibilities
This job has no direct reports but may occasionally be responsible for delegating assignments and tasks on a project basis. Also, may be assigned coaching/mentoring tasks to help develop less experienced team members.
IV. Qualifications
The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.
A. Education and Experience
Education: Bachelor's Degree (accredited), or in lieu of degree, High School Diploma or GED (accredited) and 4 years of relevant work experience
Experience: Five (5) years of relevant experience (in addition to education requirement)
B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements
Preferred: PMI Certification.
C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities That Contribute to Success
Data Analytics/Reporting tools such as PowerBI.
D. Key Competencies
Aligning Performance for Success – Focusing and guiding others in accomplishing work objectives.
Building Partnerships – Identifying opportunities and taking action to build strategic relationships between one’s area and other areas, teams, departments, units or organizations to help achieve business goals.
Building Trust – Interacting with others in a way that give them confidence in one’s intentions and those of the organization.
Coaching and Developing Others – Providing feedback, instruction and development guidance to help others excel in their current or future job responsibilities; planning and supporting the development of individual skills and abilities.
Decision Making – Identifying and understanding issues, problems, and opportunities; comparing data from different sources to draw conclusions; using effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; taking action that is consistent with available facts, constraints, and probable consequences.
Facilitating Change – Encouraging others to seek opportunities for different and innovative approaches to addressing problems and opportunities, facilitating the implementation and acceptance of change within the workplace.
High-Impact Communication – Clearly and succinctly conveying information and ideas to individuals and groups in a variety of situations; communicating in a focused and compelling way that drives others’ thoughts and actions.
Planning and Organizing – Establishing courses of action for self and others to ensure that work is completed efficiently.
Strategic Decision Making – Obtaining information and identifying key issues and relationships relevant to achieving a long-range goal or vision; committing to a course of action to accomplish a long-range goal or vision after developing alternatives based on logical assumptions, facts, available resources, constraints, and organizational values.

Benefits
At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company match on 401K, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site.

2+ years of experience as a data or business analyst

Analytical skills that allow for the development of data-driven reports

Abillity to analyze large datasets and resolve data issues
Excellent critical thinking skills and ability to disseminate large volumes of data to identify trends

Highly detail oriented
Demonstrated ability to manage time and prioritize projects to meet deadlines. Must be able to work overtime during key periods.

Experience with VBA, Salesforce, or BI tools such as Power BI a plus.

Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:
The Specialist/Analyst level requires a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 2-5 years of relevant job-related experience
The Senior Specialist/Analyst level requires a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 5-8 years of relevant job-related experience
The Lead Specialist/Analyst level requires a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 8+ years of relevant job-related experience

Working Conditions:

Usually, normal office working conditions.

Responsible for designing, developing, and managing effective and efficient processes/systems for the agency's affordable housing portfolio, including Public Housing, Project-Based Assistance/Vouchers, Low Income Housing Tax Credits, Rental Demonstration Programs, and Conventional Housing programs. Catalyzes creating and maintaining various dashboards, statistical analyses, and narratives to provide critical information supporting programmatic, financial, and operational decisions. Essential tasks include database management, financial/data analysis, system design, contract compliance, performance management, workflow and communication tracking, internal audits, and tenant accounting. Reports to the Director of Asset Management.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyze data and synthesize management reports to track operations, measure program effectiveness, and make recommendations to achieve desired outcomes and results.
Make recommendations on the development, deployment, and ongoing improvement of existing operational protocols, data systems, and software applications, including redesigning workflows and processes.
Collect and review data to confirm accuracy in preparing various reports (departmental, agency, and board reports, funders, investors, etc.).
Update and monitor execution of timely and accurate billing of agency-approved charges applied to tenant accounts (security deposits, maintenance charges, other fees, etc.).
Solicit feedback/facilitates discussions with stakeholders on system enhancements and document/file requirements and ensures that the staff, contractors, and others correctly implement changes.
Analyze financial reports, statements, invoices, bids/quotes, and/or budgets prepared by Management Agents to ensure compliance with Management Agreements, Policies, Regulatory requirements, and/or any other governing documents. Statistical/Narrative reports of any findings and corrective actions shall be provided to management.
Facilitate training and/or create training resources for internal staff, management agents, and stakeholders regarding changes in business processes, protocols, technical systems, and/or applications.
Design file management systems, databases and instructing others on their use. Materials may include applications, financial statements, contracts, correspondences, certifications, planning documents/studies, templates, letters, audits, and reports.
Perform contract administration duties by monitoring financial activities (income/expenses/liabilities) to ensure compliance with budget authority, budget limits, procurement, insurance policies, capital funds grants, covenants, investor/partnership limits, grants, audits, other housing providers, etc.
Review and monitor tenant charges applied to tenant statements for accuracy and ensure timely distribution of the statements at public housing sites.
Assist in coordinating training and professional development sessions to include content and curriculum development and coordination of logistics.
Review End of Participation/Move-Out reports confirming Tenant's Final Statement of Charges is complete and accurate to allow accounts to be resolved, timely processing of security deposit refunds correctly, or recording debt owed to the agency.
Collaborate with Finance on the processing of debt owed notices and acceptance of payments received from former tenants to resolve outstanding balances.
Conduct compliance reviews on tenant accounts in tenant software programs utilized by the agency and/or management agents; to ensure timely and accurate recording of debits, credits, and liabilities. Requires collaboration with Management Agents, Finance, and IT to ensure deficiencies are fully resolved.
Track tenant debt owed and frequently prepare uncollected debt reports for management's review and board approval. Requires the completion of board resolutions, recording debt owed to third-party collection services, and reporting to HUD's centralized electronic database.
Accept and coordinate with management agent's completion of tenant verification requests from other housing providers.
Collaborate with Finance and Management Agents to process and e-distribute tenant rent statements.
Review utility usage spreadsheets provided by meter reading contractors to ensure accuracy and use the data to create monthly utility statements for tenants.
Collaborate with Finance and Management Agents in monitoring net income and expenses, as well as property taxes. Conduct periodic analysis and pursue filing exemptions, appeals, and/or adjustments as deemed appropriate.
Collaborate with leadership and Management Agents to assist in formulating funding plans, proformas, budget projections, and management practices for new real estate developments.
Conduct market analysis to ensure administrative and system changes are executed to properly adjust rents, fees, utility charges & allowances, etc.
Collaborate with Finance to execute/collect payment and billing terms mandated by private lease agreements executed for non-residential space (Daycares, Educational Centers, Office space, etc.)
Conduct compliance reviews on rent & utility calculations to ensure accuracy.
Perform other duties as assigned.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of federal, state, and local laws, rules, and regulations, about low-income housing and Houston Housing Authority policies and procedures.
Knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of public housing management. Some knowledge of principles, procedures, and methods of budgeting and data processing.
Knowledge of community resources and social service agencies is essential for optimum results and program development and implementation.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with other employees and the public and deal effectively with situations requiring one to be tactful and diplomatic, yet firm.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, verbally and in writing.
Ability to compile and interpret statistical data for effective reporting.
Ability to develop training materials and make effective presentations.
Bilingual communication is highly desirable.


COMPLEXITY / SCOPE OF WORK

The employee performs a wide variety of related activities.
Work is primarily routine and repetitive. The employee identifies what needs to be done and determines how to accomplish it.
The employee coordinates, integrate, and prioritizes the tasks.
The employee occasionally makes decisions regarding unusual circumstances or conflicting data.
The position is a crucial employee in the management and operation of affordable housing. The employee's work affects applicants, current residents, community groups, and support agencies continuously. The employee's successful accomplishment of duties greatly enhances the Houston Housing Authority's ability to meet its overall mission.


SUPERVISORY CONTROLS

The employee does not have supervisory responsibilities.
Typically, the employee plans and carries out routine work activities with minimal supervision and independently resolves problems.
The employee receives specific instructions when complaints are brought to the attention of the Director of Asset Management and/or their designee.
The employee's work is evaluated for conformity to organizational policies and attainment of personal performance evaluation objectives.


PERSONAL CONTACTS

The employee has contact with Houston Housing Authority employees at all levels and with various persons, including the general public, the media, residents, resident association officers, officials, and representatives of different social service, educational and local, state, and federal agencies.
The primary purposes of contacts are to gain, clarify, or give information; plan, coordinate, and advise on work efforts; motivate, influence, or direct persons or groups; and justify, defend, negotiate, or resolve controversial matters or issues.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORK ENVIRONMENT

Work is primarily sedentary and involves some physical exertion during visits and inspection of units and developments.
Moderate physical exertion such as bending, stooping, crouching, and climbing stairs is needed for field visits.
Work may require travel to meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Work hours may vary from the standard core hours of the agency and may involve weekend work on occasions.
Work involves the typical risks and discomforts associated with an office environment and visits to outdoor developments, sites, dwellings, or facilities, inspections of structures.
Work may involve confrontations with applicants and residents.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelors' Degree in Business Administration or a related field from an accredited college or university preferred.
Five years of progressive experience in financial and statistical analysis or policy development on property management or asset management
Proficient computer skills are required, proficient in Microsoft Office products.
Bondable.
Valid Texas driver's license.
Eligibility for coverage under Authority PHA fleet auto insurance.

Position Description:
The Senior Business Analyst position in the HR Systems organization primary responsibility is to provide expertise around HP's Core Human Capital Management System (HCM) as well as the Recruiting system functionality, business processes and configuration specifically for the Human Resources function. This role will have the opportunity to work across many areas of HP to analyze a rich collection of strategies, processes and systems specific to HR. Also, this position will work with a variety of people and technologies to evaluate system solutions and delivery mechanisms for our internal customers, while finding creative new ways of partnering with different business teams, functional groups, and IT partners to deliver new and enhanced processes and tools including using Workday Extend to build/support new applications.
Responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to the following:
Represent and drive HR systems needs

Partner with internal customers, examining complex issues or concerns to find a long-term solution, both process and system related
Develop detailed implementation plans and update project plans in conjunction with other system analysts
Document processes, procedures, or new approaches
Identify operation issues, gaps and lead implementation of a system solution related to Human Resources Master Data processes
Work cooperatively with business analysts to ensure all enhancements are fully tested
Provide initial assessment of change requests and system issues and partner with IT as necessary to troubleshoot or correct problems
Maintain and cultivate relations with key customer contacts
Assist with and/or manage documentation, including user guides, training materials, and release notes
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree, or foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, Information Systems, Human Resources or a closely related discipline
Minimum of 2-6 years’ experience in HR or technical related area
Strong knowledge of Workday HR configuration and HR business processes
Demonstrate the highest level of integrity and professionalism
Solid project management skills, especially coordinating/managing several Global projects at the same time, with well-developed sense of urgency, precision and follow through
Detail oriented with superior analytical, problem solving, pragmatism and organization skills
Strong business analysis skills
Proven experience working in project oriented high-performing teams
Strong personal networking skills with the ability to relate to executives and employees through all organizational levels
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly present complex business and technical topics to a wide array of business, technical, and executive audiences
Independent worker and definite self-starter.
Experience working with enterprise systems is a plus
Experience in large size companies with multiple functions / business units is a plus
Workday certification is a plus

The Environmental Analyst will play a key role in Supply Chain’s Environmental Sustainability, Social Responsibility, and Governance (ESG) strategy by managing and continuously improving environmental data collection, analysis, and reporting processes for the company’s locations. The Environmental Analyst will report to the Director of the Center of Excellence and will work with the Indirect Services Team and the Environmental, Social and Governance committee to establish sustainability goals, identify environmental footprint reduction projects, and monitor and report SCI’s accomplishments to internal and external stakeholders. Key responsibilities include researching environmental reporting trends and best practices, continuously improving environmental data collection and consumption behavior for the company’s locations.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Implement and manage standardized processes to collect, analyze, and report on environmental sustainable data and related financial data that align with selected ESG standard reporting frameworks.
Conduct research about environmental reporting trends and best practices.
Work with data capture software to design, and continuously improve the tools used for environmental data collection, calculations, analysis, monitoring, and reporting.
Collaborate with business process owners to identify opportunities to improve consumption behavior.
Identify opportunities to impact utility and other environmental consumption reduction.
Support projects that drive process improvement surrounding environmental practices.
Collaborate with ESG steering committee leadership members to establish applicable goals and targets.
Coordinate with strategic suppliers to identify ESG sustainability data and evaluate environmental footprint reduction projects, support project implementation, and monitor and report on results.
Attend industry webinars, conferences and other events
Prepare reporting and PowerPoint documentation of data collection, analysis, and reporting processes and results.
MINIMUM Requirements
Education
Bachelor’s degree in a field related to Business Management, Environmental Management, Data Science, or a similarly technical and engineering-minded field preferred.
Experience
5 years’ of related business experience, 3+ years supporting environmental projects and/or preparing environmental reporting that align with the leading ESG frameworks.
Experience developing environmental data collection systems, tools, databases, and/or software.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Strong organizational, planning, and project management skills.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to analyze data, leveraging information to provide clear, concise and supported recommendations for action.
Interest and experience in common and best practices covering environmental and supplier sustainability.
Capacity to work independently and simultaneously handle a variety of complex matters under deadline pressure.
Ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with other stakeholder groups.
Strong skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Power BI.
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills to provide strategic advice to various disciplines across the company related to ESG matter.
Strong written communication and verbal skills.
Work CONDITIONS

Work indoors during all seasons
Standard business attire required

Climbing stairs to access buildings occasionally
Physical Demands
Physical effort requiring manual dexterity is required, includes paperwork, calculators, computers and phone usage

positionName: Revenue Integrity Analyst- Medical Museum Tower
description:
The Revenue Integrity Analyst will create and maintain documentation of charge posting processes, as well as monitor and support departmental charge reconciliation for the Physician Organization (PO). The Analyst will oversee internal controls and routinely reviews, tests, and validates to ensure revenue integrity.

Requirements:
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

People 15%

Develops, fosters and maintains a network of all organizational stakeholders involved in charge entry and processing to assist in the efficient resolution of charge reconciliation issues
Finance 25%

Develops and implements internal controls to effectively monitor the integrity of system charging processes
Analyzes monitoring tools, and identifies and communication significant fluctuations in volumes and or gross revenue at a departmental or ancillary charging system level in a timely manner
Monitors reports for trends and identification of missed revenue opportunities and areas for potential revenue enhancement
Quality/Service 25%

Performs charge audits by verifying billing data as compared to documentation and identifies training opportunities to improve documentation, charge flow, and accuracy
Reviews denials and rejections pertaining to documentation and medical necessity of charges, identifies root-cause issues and formulates process improvement initiatives to prevent future occurrences
Identifies charge capture issues and work with appropriate PO Central Business Office (CBO) or department leadership to resolve issues
Maintains current and accurate Charge Description Master (CDM) and updates procedure codes as required by management and through work queue activity
Service 10%

Ensures protection of private health and personal information. Adheres to all HIPAA and PCI compliance regulations.
Growth/Innovation 25%

Assists in establishing consistency across practices as changes in processes, tools, and overall practices are developed; this should ensure a focus on continued system integration and overall system benefit
Implements and maintains a comprehensive online reference for all organizational stakeholders to view internal control monitors and document any significant revenue impact issues
Designs and presents work aids and curriculum to improve charge posting processes
Qualifications:
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

Associates degree in healthcare, business or related field. Bachelor's degree preferred.
EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

3 years of experience in clinical documentation practices in both inpatient and outpatient settings
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES AND REGISTRATIONS REQUIRED

AAPC or AHIMA certification preferred

SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED

Excellent writing, oral and interpersonal communication skills. Must have the ability to handle sensitive information with discretion, and to communicate effectively with all levels of personnel.
Must have the ability to effectively leverage technology to manage and analyze data from multiple data sources.
Understanding of CPT, ICD-9/ICD-10 coding
Knowledge of medical billing practices
Knowledge of insurance requirements for physician visits and procedures
Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment, prioritize projects and work independently with attention to detail
Demonstrate a high level of professionalism, customer service and interpersonal skills
Ability to analyze, identify and articulate identified trends and report trends succinctly in a clear and concise manner
Ability to think critically and identify the global impact across the revenue cycle with a solution oriented approach

Company Profile:
Houston Methodist Specialty Physician Group is comprised of more than 500 doctors committed to delivering personalized, patient-focused care to the Houston community and beyond. Our priority is to make sure every patient is heard and supported throughout his or her experience with us. Patients who choose the specialty physician group also benefit from our coordinated-care approach, which places a wealth of highly qualified specialists and resources at their service, all committed to the high standard of care patients have come to expect from Houston Methodist.

General Summary

The Business Data Analyst, Sales (BDA) will be a strategic thinker and execution minded business partner. As a Subject Matter Expert (SME) of Envoy's market evolution, the BDA will help maximize revenue growth through disciplined and collaborative management of sales, marketing and pricing processes. The BDA will develop ways to improve Data Analytics reporting, analysis, performance and sales outcomes. The BDA works in partnership and close alignment with corporate functions including marketing, research and pricing, and the divisional and branch management leaders to drive sales success in their assigned division. This position offers insights and drives innovation to the broader business, drives simplification across the business process and assists in the development and execution of key strategies for sustained growth. Where others see columns of numbers, the Business Data Analyst will discover and share valuable information. To be successful, the BDA should be naturally curious and inquisitive, and enjoy discovering and implementing new ideas, as well as capitalizing efficiencies. A strong can-do attitude is needed to manage competing deadlines and overcome obstacles when challenges arise. The Business Data Analyst should be able to inspire a team to work toward a shared goal and communicate effectively with others in different roles, functions, and levels.

The Business Data Analyst will serve as the Divisional SME in sales operations process and performance, and partner with the Divisional Leadership and Branch Managers to:

Develop the company's strategy for improving the effectiveness of our branch sales and marketing efforts,
Improve the process discipline and effectiveness of our sales organization,
Improve the "win" rate for those borrowers who engage Envoy, and
Promote ongoing evolution and adoption of revenue generating tools, process, activities and best practices.

Duties and Responsibilities

The primary job duties and responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:

Strategy Responsibilities:

Lead business reviews with divisional and branch leaders to share trends and analysis of the sales performance of market peer group companies and benchmark Envoy to our peers
Work with Divisional leadership and Executive Team on future market-based quota development and sales performance benchmarking
Champion the strategic development and lead the tactical implementation of the annual operating plans with respect to origination volume and pricing strategy
Provide and improve the necessary tools, reports and analysis to accomplish the revenue objectives
Planning for the sales function, including headcount updates, communications, sales plan development, and budget management
Identify growth markets and work with management to develop a business case for entering said markets
Monitor and reinforce the value and adoption of sales processes and tools, through data analytics
Serve as the conduit through which enterprise strategy translates to tactical action in branch offices
Develop and lead business reviews with Divisional and Branch leaders to share trends and analysis of the sales performance of market peer group companies and benchmark Envoy to our peers
Analyze business operations to understand strengths and weaknesses, to determine opportunities to automate and simplify processes and functions
Provide analysis and financial modeling to support and make recommendations to senior leaders to enable strategy and market planning in cooperation with finance and the leadership team
Utilize business intelligence systems and processes to enable informed decision making
Inform the branch pricing decisions with local market, near real time data. Assist corporate and branch leaders in assessing how local pricing compares to the most relevant peer groups
Develop "Monte Carlo" models to simulate the impacts of how Envoy reacts to market pricing
Continually promote awareness and enforcement of marketing campaigns and best practices to sales colleagues

Operational Responsibilities:

Develop and operationalize a data driven fact-based sales pipeline, tracking the borrower journey from initial conversation, through the application, processing, underwriting and eventual funding of a loan
Manage the sales pipeline in coordination with the branch leadership with an emphasis on velocity and conversion
Facilitate and manage sales pipeline reviews with corporate, divisional and branch leadership
Analyze sales data to drive accurate forecasting and funnel management, and to identify opportunities for greater efficiency
Develop and support business metrics/ KPIs and analytics in various share formats to drive business operations
Proactively identify opportunities to improve the sales process and to assist the sales management in understanding process bottlenecks and inconsistencies.
Support efforts to standardize processes and systems (e.g., CRM, Marketing Automation, etc.) to enable accurate and efficient data collection and management of the company's sales efforts
Fulfill sales related ad hoc requests
Support Divisional leadership in recommending, initiating and managing actions down through the division based on the data
Analyze effects of pricing influences to borrower engagement (e.g., leading to win or loss) and how pricing compares to local competitors
Reinforce through awareness, measurement and communication the use of marketing campaigns and tools to branch locations and Loan Officers
Measure and monitor use of marketing and provide feedback to marketing related to adoption and efficacy of marketing strategy"
Regularly measure and communicate the adoption and execution of marketing campaigns and activities
Analyze sales and financial and customer outcomes to evaluate effectiveness of marketing activities
Work closely with branch and divisional managers to share knowledge, best practices and facilitate standardization across the whole sales organization
Sales and marketing enablement, in coordination with the marketing team, ensure awareness of marketing campaigns and implementation by Branch Managers and Loan Originators
Partner with the Learning and Development team in the planning and implementation of sales enablement training
Maintain regular attendance, plus potential overtime, as necessary
Position is primarily based out of Envoy Corporate HQ (Houston, TX) and may require occasional overnight travel
Additional responsibilities as directed
Requirements:
Qualifications

5 + years' experience in a business or financial analyst role with emphasis on financial or sales operations
A bachelor's degree in an analytical or financial discipline required
Preferred Mortgage Lending, Real Estate or Financial Services Industry experience
Proven experience using a disciplined approach to facilitating business review meetings; the analysis and forecasting of the sales pipeline
Proficient in MS Office Suite: Word, PowerPoint and advanced Excel skills required, SQL skill a plus
Expertise with BI Tools like Tableau, Excel, PowerBI, PowerPivot, PowerQuery preferred
Experience or familiarity with CRM and Marketing automation tool as a support to sales processes
Experience with various sales compensation and rewards/recognition strategies
Strong analytical, research, problem solving, and attention to detail are essential, along with the ability to identify issues and develop sound, practical, and creative solutions
Strong mathematical and data modeling skills
Proven ability to work well under pressure and adjust to varied workload in a fast-paced environment, able to demonstrate specific experience managing change towards growth
Exceptional follow-up, time management, interpersonal, and verbal and written communication skills; comfortable engaging at all levels in an organization to deliver results
Possess willingness to adjust to and drive change in processes
A team player who works productively and cooperatively with a wide range of people

Physical/Mental Requirements

The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear
The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl

Position Summary: The Business Analyst II serves as the designated system administrator/subject matter expert for Compliance 360 (C360), SecondLook, and PolicyTech, while working with the internal/external business partners to efficiently streamline operational processes either through analysis of existing functions and/or automation.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Partner with department leadership to oversee all implementation efforts for C360 modules: Legal/Compliance, Analytics, Operations, Risk and Audit, and overall Maintenance.
Develop/Create tools in C360 to automate manual processes currently performed by business units.
Manage/Serve as designated point of contact for all C360 and PolicyTech operational issues and performance.
Develop/Enhance module components in C360 to help streamline processes with current participating business partners (Human Resources, Vendor Management, and Legal)
Consults with functional unit management and personnel to identify, define and document business needs and objectives levels of software access.
Setup and configure C360 and SecondLook audits to support internal users for each testing cycle.
Partner with department leadership to oversee all SecondLook audit companions, workgroups and executive reporting.
Create/Develop weekly, monthly, bi-monthly, quarterly, semi-annual, and annual dashboard/ad hoc reports for senior level management.
Coordinates and manages all user-based test scripting for current/new C360 modules.
Build/Compile reports data for C360, TenA, and PolicyTech with the ability to present to department leadership.
Oversee the maintenance of all user accounts and authentication for Compliance 360 and PolicyTech.
Assist the compliance, in-line quality assurance, quality assurance monitoring, and quality control teams in identifying opportunities for improving business processes through systems and/or software changes; assists in the preparation of proposals to develop/acquire new systems and/or operational changes; assists in the cost-benefit analysis of a recommended solution(s); plays a lead role in the execution of the selected solution(s), including monitoring of key milestones for delivery and end-user training.
Ability to extract, manipulate and analyze data using complex SQL query statements and advanced database tools.
Acts as a liaison between departmental end-users, IT, line of business leaders, software developers, consultants and others in the analysis, configuration, testing and maintenance of software to ensure optimal operational performance.
Provides technical assistance in training, mentoring, and coaching professional and technical staff.
Develops training curriculum and conducts formal training sessions covering C360 and QC software.
Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Description

GULF COAST REGIONAL BLOOD CENTER
(Location: 1400 La Concha Lane in Houston, Texas 77045)

TITLE/CODE: Desktop Administrator
DEPARTMENT: Management Information Systems

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
Responsible for performing the analysis, design, migration, operation, and testing of data warehouse as well as the software systems that produce the warehoused data and for defining processes and the systems requirements for supporting those processes .
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following; other duties may be assigned. Management retains the discretion to add to or change the duties of the position at any time.
Perform analysis during initial design and problem solving of assignments. Work with users to prioritize service/report requests and assign to the appropriate staff.
Perform testing, tuning, installation, maintenance and evaluation of new releases of software as required.
Develop and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) jobs and data cleansing used to manage the data and to maintain integrity for reporting.
Design and develop new data structures to ensure consistency and integration with existing data warehouse structure and dashboards and reports.
Design and monitor end-user reporting tools and systems, ensuring reports are accurate and up-to-date and that data/reports meet users’ needs.
Perform fact finding to develop and/or modify information systems or test plans as assigned.
Develop program specifications including database design, program specifications and process flowcharts.
Assist with user training/documentation/post-implementation turnover to business and application support personnel.
Participate in testing/validation and implementation of various data warehouse system related functions.
Perform data warehouse maintenance and systems implementation.
Ensure compliance with regulations and standards applicable to assigned responsibilities.
Enforce The Blood Center's policies on EEO, Affirmative Action and Safety and Health.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS
Safety
Must not pose a direct threat or significant risk of substantial harm to the safety or health of himself/herself or others. Must comply with all applicable safety rules and policies and be willing to report actual and potential safety violations to the appropriate supervisor or manager.
Attendance
Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance at such level as is determined in The Blood Center’s sole discretion.
Regular Hours
Full time: must be regularly available to work at least 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week, or such other days or hours per week as The Blood Center determines are necessary to meet business needs.
Overtime (applicable only to non-exempt positions)
Must be available and willing to work such overtime per day or per week as The Blood Center determines is necessary or desirable to meet business needs.
Weekend and Holidays
Must be available and willing to work such weekends and holidays as The Blood Center determines are necessary or desirable to meet its business needs.
Off-Site Work
Must occasionally be able to work at off site locations and transport self to same.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university or equivalent experience is required. Minimum of two years of experience with SQL and business intelligence reports, utilizing an Oracle or MS SQL Server database, preferably in a regulated environment. Prior experience with ETL tools, DTS, PL/SQL, Business Objects, Crystal Reports, database administration.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
None

LANGUAGE SKILLS
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence, independently. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent.

REASONING ABILITY
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Computer Literate

POSITION DRIVING STATUS
Non-Driver

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to operate a computer and other office machinery and remain in a stationary position. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Employees are required to be familiar with and abide by the team lift requirements as specified in the Safety Program.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to blood and/or blood components, as well as any other biohazard materials.

company: Gulf Coast Educators Federal Credit Union
description:
Gulf Coast Educators FCU is looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist! The Business Intelligence Specialist is expected to assist the BI Coordinator in forming and communicating business solutions based on data extracted from a variety of sources. Under the direction of the BI Coordinator, performs specialized financial research and organizes customer services operations data to support in the development of corporate decisions and trend analysis. The position will disseminate the data collected and properly align those results with corporate goals and strategic plan.

The ideal candidate will possess strong critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills. A strong background in mathematics, advanced Excel skills, and knowledge of SQL will also be beneficial.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities:

Assist with the administration of the Credit Union s MCIF, CRM, Data Warehouse, and any other information systems to analyze and aggregate information to assist in and identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions.
Perform scheduled daily, weekly, and monthly data extractions to assist the BI Coordinator. Including extraction, manipulation, cleansing, formatting, processing and analysis.
Stay current and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, automation, analysis, validation and documentation.
Responsible for compliance with the Bank Secrecy Act and all governmental regulations and Credit Union Policies and guidelines. Responsible for identifying reportable transactions under the Bank Secrecy Act, obtaining required information and reporting transactions. Responsible for complying with Federal Rules and Regulations as required by NCUA.
Performs other job related duties as assigned.

One year to three years of similar or related experience.
(1) A two-year college degree, or an equivalent amount of experience.
Advanced technical skills; Attention to detail; Decision making/judgment; Problem solving; high level of demonstrated initiative.

Company Description
Founded in 1934, Parker Drilling provides advanced drilling solutions to the energy industry. We are a technically innovative company providing worldwide drilling services, rental tools and project management, including rig design, construction and operations management.
Job Description
The Business Analyst III is responsible for the support, maintenance and configuration of Oracle applications and other peripheral applications. This position will report to Sr. IT Applications Manager.
Essential functions
Provide Oracle subject matter expertise to assist the users and IT team in supporting Parker Drilling’s Oracle E-Business Suite.
Understand business problems, processes and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.
Provide Oracle applications support and guidance ensuring daily operations are running smoothly, which includes troubleshooting, resolving issues, training, documentation and tracking of tickets within the support ticketing queue.
Support users in critical processes.
Collaborate with Users, Development team, other BAs and any involved vendors in the planning, design, development and deployment of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.
Create test plans, test cases, test scripts and perform functional testing working with end users and Development team.
Review and maintain existing configurations/setups and make corrections and changes as needed with adequate documentation.
Interact effortlessly with business user community to determine and document new functional or technical requirements, to work with other IT professionals to implement solutions.
Develop new reporting solutions to streamline business processes through the use of Oracle Reports & EIS Reports.
Develop training materials including work instructions and process maps as required by the Business / IT Teams.
Provide super users with additional training regarding Oracle EBS and business best practices.
Work with 3rd Party Oracle Support for standard functionality issue resolutions & patches.
Coordinate integration testing, user acceptance testing, training and documentation.
Demonstrates ability to problem solve and generate innovative solutions in conjunction with customers, vendors, and Information Technology.
Follow Company standards, policies and support processes.
Other duties as assigned by Supervisor / Manager.
Additional functions:
Provide Oracle SCM, EAM & Manufacturing subject matter expertise.
Responsible for the support, maintenance, and configuration of Oracle E-Business Suite applications for SCM, EAM & Manufacturing Modules.
Responsible for supporting other peripheral applications used to supplement Oracle EBS.
Qualifications
Necessary qualifications, skills and abilities
Bachelor degree in Information Technology or Business related degree or relevant significant work experience.
Minimum of 4 – 6 years hands-on experience in Implementing/ Supporting Oracle modules.
Working knowledge of global oilfield services processes and applications including operations, supply chain, human resources and financial functions.
Strong technical understanding of Oracle’s tables and dataflows, Workflows, PL/SQL, 3rd Party Interfaces preferred.
Understand business needs and interpret, communicate and implement technical solutions to fulfil those needs.
Knowledge of the agile method preferred.
Strong SDLC experience with exposure to Oracle AIM methodologies preferred.
Must be able to handle multiple tasks simultaneously while managing time in a proficient and effective manner.
Possess the functional, technical and analytical abilities sufficient for the support and configuration of Oracle applications, including experience with Oracle workflows, personalization, interfaces and extensions.
Must have analytical/problem solving skills in order to be able to gather, sort and analyze data to develop logical conclusions.
Must have good written and verbal communication skills and able to effectively communicate with colleagues, management, and vendors.
Must be a detail oriented, self-starter and able to work with little supervision while maintaining goals/tasks.
Must be capable of working in a team environment.
Additional qualifications, skills and abilities
 4 – 6 years hands-on experience in Implementing/ Supporting Oracle SCM, EAM & Manufacturing modules (PO, iProcurement, iSupplier, Sourcing, INV, CST, EAM, QA, WIP, BOM, OM).
Working knowledge on Oracle Financials & Projects modules preferred.
Multi-Currency & Multi-Organization Knowledge and be well versed in supporting SCM and EAM modules across multiple countries.

Description
KBX Technology Solutions provides logistics solutions for its customers through innovative technology that helps deliver actionable intelligence, eliminate waste and redundancies, and create greater operational efficiencies in the marketplace. KBX Technology Solutions is a subsidiary of KBX, a Koch Industries Inc. company. As part of Koch Industries, we have a significant purchasing position and the leading-edge talent to create an advantage in the marketplace. As a privately held company, we are able to embrace long-term visions and invest in the future through our holistic application of Market-Based Management®. To learn more visit www.KBXLogistics.com.
KBX Tech is seeking a Senior Business Analyst that will play a key role in collaborating with internal and external customers to design solutions that will optimize business processes through innovative software solutions. In this role, the candidate will facilitate business process improvements via the methodical investigation, analysis, review, and documentation of functional business requirements. This resource manages the requirements definition process through the design, analysis, specification, and verification of multiple levels of requirements from an end-to-end perspective and ensures that the development team is able to effectively interpret and build solutions based on those requirements.
A successful candidate will have the following:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Strong initiative and be a self-starter with limited management oversight
Proven analytical, research, and problem-solving skills
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships in an agile/scrum team, along with other critical roles in the Software Development Lifecycle
Demonstrated ability to work successfully on software products in an iterative/agile model
What You Will Do In Your Role
Build productive relationships with our Customer Success team and our customers, in discovering opportunities to build and enhance software for optimal value and enhanced user experience
Challenge customers respectfully in order to thoroughly understand their needs and the problems that need to be solved, and through curiosity, get to the why
Design software solutions that adhere to agreed-upon organizational standards, design principles and that follow industry best practices and modernization.
Foster a professional and entrepreneurial work environment, consistently looking for innovative ways to provide value to the business and customers
Support quality efforts through system testing, working with QA testing resources and assisting in the creation of testing plans as needed
Be the liaison between the Customer/Customer Success and the development and support teams
The Experience You Will Bring
Requirements:
5+ years of experience in solving customer needs through software design implementation
Experience in Transportation and/or Logistics industry
High School Diploma
What Will Put You Ahead
Bachelor's Degree
Experience in Project Management
Experience in designing software products in an agile/scrum environment
Experience in creating wireframes in the design process
Customer implementation experience
Experience with API and EDI integration
Experience with manipulating JSON and the ability to read/understand data from a testing perspective

Sunnova is a different kind of Power Company, offering solar and storage services to homeowners within the United States and its territories through our network of local solar dealers and solar standard community homebuilders. Our mission is to Power Energy IndependenceTM and change the energy industry. At Sunnova, we believe in achieving more by working together; our diverse workforce allows an inclusive and innovative culture to power our long-term growth. Our people focus on thinking beyond traditional limits – and to do that, we need the creativity and energy of every person.

Come be a part of the fastest growing segment of the energy industry!

The OPERATIONS BUSINESS ANALYST Position
Sunnova is currently looking for an Operations Business Analyst who will provide substantial analytical support for Sunnova’s Customer Care department that will be utilized to drive critical business decisions. The Operations Business Analyst will work closely with a team of driven professionals to assist in operational tracking and reporting on service-related activity.

Completes various additional tasks and projects as requested from management

Strong analytical and detail-oriented aptitude applying advanced knowledge of business protocols & metrics; a high degree of accuracy is required
Proficient in Microsoft office, specifically Excel analytical capability and Outlook

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to excel in a team-oriented environment

Description:

Are you looking for head-scratching professional challenges that will rock your world? Look no further, Callon Petroleum is looking for a Business Analyst to join our team based in Houston, TX.
Callon Petroleum Company is an independent oil and natural gas company focused on growing production and reserves from our oil-weighted, multi-play, multi-pay assets in the Permian and Eagle Ford Basins.
Our people are passionate and innovative, and shape our understanding of what is possible and challenge us to consider new ideas. If you are looking for a rewarding career, and in a highly-collaborative, fast-paced, fully-empowered environment, Callon is where you belong.
About the role
The Business Analyst will work in a team that is the primary interface between business units and IT. They will analyze complex business needs presented by the user community and recommend and implement technical solutions by working with Sr. Business Analysts, System Analysts and/or outside contractors as directed by the Manager of Applications.
duties include

Communicate status to management proactively

knowledge and abilities

experience

Who we are
American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.
As a Deconversion Analyst at AIG Retirement Services, you will be the point of contact and liaison for assigned retirement plan transition projects. You will provide responsive and proactive customer service and consultation at the group level. In this role, you will be a resource for subject matter expertise on retirement plans and the transition processes. Because of your influence, whether direct or indirect, we are able to deliver powerful outcomes for our clients.
Get to know the business
AIG is in the business of helping people achieve a secure and fulfilling retirement. We support our customers in reaching their financial goals, providing them the freedom and peace of mind to enjoy their retirement years. We call this being FutureFIT. This approach helps our customers take control of their financial wellness, helping millions of people plan and save for their goals. With the combined strength and wealth of products of AIG Retirement Services and member companies, you can apply your financial planning skills to make a real difference in the lives of people who need your help.
About the role
We want to hear from you today if you can:
Manage full-life cycle transition project including but not limited to facilitate meetings with internal and external stakeholders; review contract; conduct research; create reporting via Excel and other systems; provide update and address issues that impact execution of project plan to all relevant stakeholders; perform testing and quality control; produce deliverables and achieve project objectives in a timely manner.
Effective and accurately review and update system fields and other components that require compliance with departmental standards.
Initiate timely and effective consultation and communication to internal/external clients via phone and or email; and maintain professional relationships to successfully achieve business needs.
Identify out of scope services and escalate as needed to ensure all services are included in pricing.
Provide guidance on technical issues to various team members to execute project.
Identifies training needs within the team and escalates to management.
Assist on rotating team assignments and other ad hoc projects, research and tasks as needed.
What we are looking for
Bachelor’s Degree in related field preferred or any combination of education and experience, which provide an equivalent background.
Minimum 4+ years of work experience in retirement plan services.
Project management and consulting experience required.
Must have excellent communication and client management skills, including verbal, written, interpersonal and presentation skills.
Intermediate to advance Excel skills required.
Ability to analyze data, determines the root cause, and provide and/or develop an appropriate solution for resolution.
Knowledge of retirement plan types and record keeping systems highly preferred.

Summary:
Reporting directly to the Shift Lead the Telemetry Data Analyst oversees data acquisition and analysis to assist in resolving field reliability issues. The position is responsible for utilizing and enhancing existing technology to drive continued improvement in rental fleet performance and reliability. Proactive review and analysis of automated reports from telemetry is a fundamental responsibility. Daily communication of alarms, trends, and mechanical issues to fleet field operations in a proactive manner is required to promote reliability and aid the Field Service Supervisor in managing rental fleet costs. It is estimated that each analyst will be responsible for monitoring the data gathered on 150-200 active CSIC rental fleet compressors. The analyst will be responsible for determining severity of issues, issue job ticket as needed with recommended repair and time frame to operations group. Distribution of time for this position is expected to be 100% in the office. This position is not a supervisor position. This is a “7 & 7 rotational” position (working seven days then off seven days).
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Complies with all the CSI EHS policies
Monitor repeat shutdowns and alarms on “Rental Fleet” units to increase mechanical availability of rental fleet assets and reduce maintenance costs associated with unplanned failures
Issue repair work tickets with FSO and recommended repair date on a proactive basis
Follow up to confirm successful diagnosis of issues and the success resolution to build accurate data base within rental fleet units
Assist in resolving technical issues when requested by field operations management
Validate and then issue repair work tickets with recommend repair/elimination of bogus data (sensors and transmitter accuracy)
Analyze “log files/extended log files” and historical data to trend reoccurring trouble units when requested by field operations management
Utilize telemetry data and extended log files to assist Field Operations to complete a Root Cause Failure Analysis on major failures
Other duties may be assigned
Requirements:

Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.
Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.
Quantity - Meets productivity standards; Completes work in timely manner; Strives to increase productivity.
Safety and Security - Observes safety and security procedures; Reports potentially unsafe conditions; Uses equipment and materials properly.
Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands.
Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time; Ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; Arrives at meetings and appointments on time.
Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals.; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.
Language Skills - Ability to read, write, and speak fluently in English. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to patiently discuss and troubleshoot mechanical issues with field personnel when requested
Mathematical Skills - Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as percentages, area, circumference, rod load, Delta P and volumes when necessary

Understanding of ancillary compression and gas production-related equipment
Good understanding of the daily rental fleet operations and interaction among rental fleet operations personnel

Ability to prepare and interpret technical and data analysis reports

Position Summary:
The Land Acquisition Analyst supports the Land Acquisition team with all aspects of land acquisition from the identification of potential land prospects to closing land transactions.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
FINANCIAL/MARKET FEASIBILITY ANALYSIS

Assist the Land Acquisition team in the preparation of financial proformas to determine the viability of proposed land acquisitions.
Work with the development team or outside developers to determine budgets and schedules to be used in proformas.
Coordinate with multiple departments to understand home construction costs and buyer preferences to be used in proformas.
Review and analyze due diligence information for potential investments
Extract & analyze data from a variety of sources including the MLS, company databases, Metrostudy, LandVision, Zonda, and other external websites.
Prepare pre-acquisition investment briefs and related support material.
Post-acquisition – maintain financial proformas and competitor analyses to assess ways to enhance performance of existing communities and to report actual performance.
Overall project document control, including correspondence, purchase orders, invoices and supporting documentation
Managing of Land Development Trade Partner contracts
Updating and managing of Land Development budgets for monthly and quarterly updates
Working with Land Development, the management of change orders and management of pay applications/invoices
Works with vendors and subcontractors to obtain appropriate insurance requirements prior to releasing payment
Creation and processing of check requests for entitlements and land development activities
Distribution and Tracking of applicable budget reports from NewStar (Accounting System)
Coordination and tracking of bonding process from request to exoneration
Perform other duties as assigned.
LAND PROFORMA SUBMISSIONS
With the guidance of Land Acquisition leadership, prepare detailed Land proformas with relevant support data for submittal to Corporate Land Committee to seek approval of new real estate transactions.
Prepare follow-up analysis and forms necessary to transact wires for said acquisitions.
LAND SEARCH FUNCTION
With the market priorities defined by Land Acquisition leadership, actively research, analyze, and identify potential land acquisition targets by extensively utilizing mapping and market data software.
Maintain a database that identifies each target and tracks the status of each.
Perform preliminary feasibility/financial analysis on each identified target and present weekly updates and recommendations to Land Acquisition leadership
MARKET TRANSACTIONAL/ENTITLEMENT MONITORING
Responsible for weekly monitoring of land transactional and entitlement activity in Division’s core markets. To include weekly summary and update of notable residential land transactions and notable entitlement activities occurring in the Division’s core markets.
AD HOC PROJECTS
Assist Land Acquisition leadership with ad hoc projects as needed.
MARKET STRATEGY
Assist the Land Acquisition team in preparing the Market Strategy report annually.
Knowledge, Skills and Background:
Highly organized with the ability to manage and prioritize workload.
Must be proficient in MS Office, especially Word and Excel, with exposure to GIS, Metrostudy, LandVision, and Zonda helpful.
Strong verbal, written and presentation skills are a must.
Proven ability to multi-task required.
Strong desire to work in land acquisition.
A background in real estate or market research is desired and professional knowledge of the home-building and land brokerage industry is highly preferred.
Ability to analyze, interpret, summarize, and report data.
Must be dependable, self-motivated, and proactive.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree Finance, Business Real Estate or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
4 years of experience in a related field.

description:
Senior Business Analyst – Decision Support Illustrations
Who we are
American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.
Get to know the business
Life and Retirement is a unique franchise that brings together a broad portfolio of life insurance, retirement and institutional products offered through an extensive, multichannel distribution network. It holds longstanding, leading market positions in many of the markets it serves in the U.S.
About the role
The Decision Support Illustrations team is responsible for development and support of software and calculation services that generate projections to illustrate how our Life Insurance products will perform given various scenarios. The projections/illustrations are used by agents and customers at Point of Sale as well as for in-force business. Our team is seeking a Senior Business Analyst who is goal-oriented, resourceful, and enjoys leading challenging projects to a successful completion. The ideal candidate will have some experience in the Life Insurance industry and have a basic understanding of Life Insurance products.

Responsible for coordinating the Illustration Review for the NY DFS Annual Certification. This will involve collaboration with Legal, Compliance, and Third-Party Administrators (TPAs) to review and assess sample illustrations for compliance with NY regulations.
Manage the remediation to correct any deficiencies identified in the NY DFS annual certification.

Research issues raised by the Product, Legal, and QA teams relating to the Illustration Print Template specifications.
Manage and organize the SharePoint repository for Illustration Print Templates.
Assist with obtaining required software release approvals.
Communicate regular updates with internal and external team members.

Bachelor’s degree in a related field; or 4+ years of directly related work experience.
2+ years of Business Analyst experience in the Life Insurance industry.
Proficiency in MS Office applications, including use of MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Strong research and data analytical skills that extend beyond the obvious end result.
Strong and effective communication skills including written, verbal, and interpersonal is a must.
Detail-oriented and a high level of accuracy for own work and team’s work product.
Strong work ethic with the ability to meet milestones and objectives with limited supervision.
Adaptable problem solver that can manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Innovative, forward thinker who proactively identifies and champions improvement projects.

Experience with the legal and regulatory environments relating to the Life Insurance industry is a plus.

Company Overview

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands (American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard) and an expanding portfolio of home services. Frontdoor serves more than two million customers across the U.S. through a network of 16,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ over 45,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unplanned breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With more than 45 years of experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually (or one request every eight seconds). For more details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Position Overview

The Analyst, A/B Testing owns the digital A/B testing process from ideation to planning, requirements gathering, execution, and analysis for Frontdoor’s DTC e-commerce products. This role works cross-departmentally so that business insights and ideas are transformed into high-impact experiments that affect operational changes and optimize site KPIs. The ideal candidate is passionate about UX and customer experience, enjoys distilling complex information into meaningful insights, and has demonstrated experience driving a culture of experimentation in an e-commerce environment.

Job Responsibilities

Own end-to-end test execution, from experiment design through analysis.

Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and objectives and translate requirements into A/B test designs.

Collaborate and ideate with product, business, and engineering stakeholders to gather and refine test ideas, generate test hypotheses, identify success metrics, and determine feasibility and prioritization of A/B tests.

Execute experiments directly in A/B testing platform or direct and coordinate larger scale cross-departmental test execution efforts with Engineering.

Manage testing calendar prioritization for experiment impact, available traffic, potential conflicts between tests and overall capacity.

Communicate timely, clear analysis of test results to key stakeholders and larger organization with insights and recommended next steps to ensure testing drives continuous improvement.

Develop and document experiment results, testing best practices and processes to continuously improve testing program.

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Information Systems, Marketing, or equivalent experience/training.

1+ years of experience in designing, implementing and analyzing A/B or MVT tests, preferably in an e-commerce environment.

Proficiency with A/B test setup and validation in leading testing and optimization platforms (Optimizely, Adobe Target, Oracle Maxymiser, Monetate, SiteSpect, Google Optimize). Optimizely Web experience preferred.

Working knowledge of HTML/CSS.

Fundamental understanding of statistics required, including hypothesis testing and experimental design.

Proficient in web analytics tools (Google Analytics), Microsoft Excel and data visualization techniques required; proficiency in SQL/R/Python preferred.

Strong demonstrated verbal and written communication abilities including presentation skills. Must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with both business and technical teams.

Experience with project management tools such as Jira and Confluence preferred.

Proven ability to handle multiple responsibilities/projects concurrently while meeting deliverables.

Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision.

Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.

Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced remote team environment.
